jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

 Résumé des fonctions 

L’analyste Exploitation des données doit analyser et gérer avec succès les données générées par les technologies, les services et les systèmes du CN ou de l’extérieur.

En plus de contribuer à l’évolution globale de l’I et T du CN, cette personne veille à ce que les membres de l’équipe et les projets respectent toutes les exigences opérationnelles.

Les clients peuvent provenir de l’équipe I et T du CN ou des divers secteurs d’activité.

L’analyste Exploitation des données travaille en collaboration avec les équipes de scientifique des données, d’opérations d’apprentissage automatique et de processus de développement et d’exploitation (DevOps) pour concevoir et améliorer des solutions de données automatisées à temps plein entre les systèmes dans le nuage.

Cette personne élabore également des codes de vérification, et conçoit et optimise les outils de surveillance. Cette personne fait partie de l’équipe Exploitation des données et dirige des analyses après action pour le soutien à l’exploitation.

 Principales responsabilités 
 Concevoir et optimiser les pipelines de données pour faciliter l’extraction de données de sources multiples et les charger dans des entrepôts de données Utiliser l’automatisation pour simplifier le traitement des données Concevoir, mettre en place et maintenir des bases de données, des systèmes de collecte de données, des analyses de données et d’autres stratégies afin d’optimiser l’efficacité et la qualité statistiques Savoir repérer, analyser et interpréter des schémas, des tendances ou des modèles dans des données complexes Tester et adopter des solutions et des outils qui respectent les pratiques exemplaires d’Exploitation des données Améliorer les processus de développement et de déploiement des données Mettre en œuvre des normes de sécurité des données qui doivent être appliquées à l’ensemble des pipelines de données
Conditions de travail

 Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. 

 Exigences minimales 
 Au moins 3 ans d’expérience de travail pertinente (avec une attention particulière en exploitation des données et en analyse des données)  Maîtrise ou baccalauréat en informatique, en génie informatique ou l’équivalent  Excellente connaissance de l’informatique infonuagique (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)  Excellente connaissance des bases de données (MySQL, NoSQL, etc.)  Excellente connaissance du codage dans Python, Java  Expérience de travail avec des données structurées et non structurées  Connaissance de l’assurance de la qualité  Connaissance de REST API et de Node API  Connaissance des outils d’intégration continue et de livraison continue (Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Github, etc.)  Connaissance en gestion des registres, en surveillance d’applications et en surveillance d’infrastructures  Expérience de Kubernetes, Kafka et MQ  Expérience d’un outil d’orchestration des données (ADF, Databricks Workflows, etc.) 
 ATOUTS 
 Expérience d’Azure Data Explorer (ADX)  Solides compétences en communication  Capacité à sortir des sentiers battus  Certification DevOps  Expérience du secteur ferroviaire et de la commande intégrale des trains (CIT)  Expérience de l’Internet des objets  Expérience des projets d’apprentissage machine (MLOps)  Connaissance des réseaux, de la sécurité et des protocoles  Certification d’analyse des données (Azure, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme)  Certification d’expert en ingénierie des données (Azure DP-203, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme) 
 À propos du CN 

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.

jobDescription:
Description
Would you like to use your talent and expertise to improve our client experience?
If so, then keep reading!
Do you enjoy carrying out complex and varied analyses in order to provide relevant decision-making information?Do you want to work with large databases? Are you familiar with advanced data analysis and integration tools (SQL, Power Python, etc.)?Do you stand out for your analytical skills and enjoy working in a team?
Are you a data analysis expert? Do you want to exercise your leadership skills?
Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Fraud initiatives concern the entire Bank; come build your career with us!
This position reports to the Manager, Cross-Sectional Data, Cybercrimes
Working With Data In The Cross-Sectional Data Team Means Providing expert advice on data engineering by working with all of the Bank's business lines and certain subsidiaries to centralize and analyze data related to:Money launderingScreeningFraudApplying rigorous analysis methods and controls to large databases to understand trends and identify faultsInteracting with other data engineers and various internal partnersHaving the opportunity to work on new data analysis trends within the industry.
Specifically, You Will
Serve as a data engineering expert to influence business lines in their organization and presentation of fraud or money laundering-related dataTake charge of complex initiatives or unusual situations that require creativity and excellent knowledge of different aspects of data engineering and analysisHelp identify and document authoritative sources of data that meet business line needsDesign, automate and implement real-time data integration solutions that meet the sector’s needs, in accordance with the Bank’s best practicesHelp improve processes and tools, and guide the choice of data analysis toolsIdentify, compare and resolve data quality issuesWork with programmers to correct data quality errorsDetermine the cause of data quality errors and make recommendations for long-term solutionsDevelop improvements to processes for overall data quality enhancementEnsure compliance with data quality standardsAnalyze, query and manipulate data in accordance with the defined business rulesDevelop rules and process to control the integrity (accuracy, rigour, process compliance) of all data in data warehousesWork with master data management tools to ensure effective data useRecommend enhancements to processes and suggest alternatives for continuous improvement of existing workflowsStay informed of and train the organization on data quality best practicesStudy new data sources and establish policies for future data collection in order to support business decisionsProvide expert advice to the management of Cross-Sectional Data on implementing activities related to the sector’s strategic orientationsBe an agent for change and ensure co-development (identify needs and suggest training activities) as part of the sector’s development in data analysisMonitor best practices and tools available in the data analysis and integration field.
Qualifications
Target profile:
Completed bachelor’s degree and 7 years of relevant experience OR completed master’s degree and 3 to 5 years of relevant experienceSolid experience in data integration and profilingKnowledge of Python and SQL languagesExperience with the implementation and use of AWS Glue, Lake Formation, RedshiftProficiency with DevOps concepts.
Preferred Skills
Proactiveness and attention to detailExperience in database modelling (e.g., 3NF, dimensional, Data Vault), an assetStrong collaborative spiritSolid time and priority management skillsKnowledge of the Agile approach (Scrum), an assetGood communication skills and ability to influenceGood command of spoken and written French.
Your Benefits
In addition to competitive compensation, upon hiring you’ll be eligible for a wide range of flexible benefits to help promote your wellbeing and that of your family.
Health and wellness program, including many optionsFlexible group insuranceGenerous pension planEmployee Share Ownership PlanEmployee and Family Assistance ProgramPreferential banking servicesInitiatives promoting community involvementTelemedicine serviceVirtual sleep clinic
These are a few of the benefits available to you. We have an offer that keeps up with trends as well as your needs and those of your family.
Our dynamic work environments and cutting-edge collaboration tools foster a positive employee experience. We actively listen to employees’ ideas. Whether through our surveys or programs, regular feedback and ongoing communication is encouraged.
People first
We’re a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have a positive impact on people’s lives.
Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that’s accessible to all employees.
We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodation, feel free to let us know during our initial conversations.
We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?
Are you ready to live your ambitions?
companyDescription:
At National Bank, we believe in the potential of each individual, and that even the smallest gestures can make a big difference. When we help others accomplish their projects, we help empower them and the community at large.  

We try to make a difference through innovation, but above all, by putting people first. By taking the time to listen and letting our actions speak for themselves. By remaining bold and passionate. By developing lasting relationships as partners and allies. 

Together we can achieve great things and create a positive impact. 

Want to learn more about us? 

For advice on your personal finances, visit: nbc.ca/advice 
For advice on your business, visit: nbc.ca/business 
For career opportunities, visit: jobs.nbc.ca 
For all the latest news, visit: nbc.ca/news 

By clicking "Follow" above, you may receive communications from National Bank, either in your LinkedIn inbox or by other means via LinkedIn, about products and services that could interest you. Learn more at: www.nbc.ca/socialnetworks.

jobTitle: Analyst / Senior Analyst – Business Intelligence & Operations [Bangkok Based]
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get to Know our Team: 
Agoda is a travel booking platform and accommodation is at our core. As our accommodation partners are a key to our success, we work hard to ensure their success. That is why the Market Management team of Agoda’s Partner Services specializes in strategic account management. We serve as consultants, offering strategic advice on how best to excel on Agoda’s commercial platform. We are direct contributors to what makes Agoda one of the market leaders because we understand accommodation needs and offer innovative solutions. From Bangkok to New York and beyond, our team has footprints in over 50 locations around the world. With the help of industry-leading technology, we work and collaborate globally to bring together the best ideas from diverse perspectives. The Market Management team invests in long-term relationships that spans borders and cultures and results in incredible value for Agoda, our partners, and our customers.
The Opportunity:
You will be working alongside business stakeholders on operational innovations and projects that facilitate the availability of actionable data to drive strategic direction. You will be integral in the design and implementation of reliable and actionable business intelligence & automation solutions that enable improved efficiency and accuracy within the Partner Services Department.
In this role, you’ll get to: 
Identify and implement initiatives that drive operational efficiencies Design analytics tools and resources aiding process enablement and discovery of process risks Communicate insights to management Build business cases and get buy-in from stakeholders Lead project delivery Design and create data tools to automate manual processes Work directly with your stakeholders to gather business requirements Make data easily accessible for users through dashboards and report automation Drive self-service business intelligence by empowering users to adopt existing BI tools (Tableau, Metabase) Capitalize on data by transforming it into business insights which will contribute to making business decisions Optimize the flow of report generation 
What you’ll need to succeed:
Qualifications:
Working experience in Business Intelligence or Analytics roles Strong communication skills with high proficiency in Thai & English Strong SQL proficiency Adept in data analysis, deriving insights and MIS reporting Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI etc. 
Skills:
You are a highly disciplined, proactive, innovative, and naturally inquisitive person. You are driven by achieving measurable, impactful results. You are able to prioritize your work based on business impact Ability to work well independently or as part of a team 
It’s great if you have:
A degree in Business Information Systems, Computer Science or Data Science Experience in managing process transformations/operational excellence programs Experience in tech, eCommerce, consultancy We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobTitle: Analyste associé principal de la gestion des données - contrat de 6 mois (hybride)/ Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst - 6 months contract (Hybrid)
jobDescription:
McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans tous les secteurs de soins de santé dans le mais d'améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 12 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Cependant, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients compétents sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'
Chez McKesson, vous participez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l'entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d'édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.
Résumé
Relevant du gestionnaire principal, Gestion des données, l'analyste associé principal de la gestion des données assure la qualité, la cohérence, l'exhaustivité et l'actualité des données de référence en veillant à ce que la création et la maintenance des données suivent les processus établis. Sa responsabilité consiste à traiter toutes les demandes et activités liées aux données de référence dans toutes les unités commerciales. Dans ce rôle, on s'attend à ce qu'il effectue des analyses des processus d'affaires, identifie les écarts et les inefficacités et propose des solutions pour aider à rationaliser les procédures. Ce rôle nécessite des interactions avec des parties prenantes internes et externes de diverses unités commerciales.
Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques
Gestion des données
Agit en tant que point de contact principal pour toutes les demandes de création ou de modification des données de base.Créez et confirmez les données de base dans les systèmes MDM.Gère les informations critiques telles que les détails du contrat, les spécifications des articles, les prix, les substitutions, les abandons et les paramètres d'intégrité des données.Créer, analyser et agir sur divers rapports de validation pour assurer le contrôle des données de base.Travailler directement avec les parties concernées internes et externes pour obtenir et valider les informations pertinentes des données de base et communiquer les normes et processus requis, en assurant la qualité et l'intégrité des données.Communiquer aux commerciaux concernés toute information pertinente reçue des partenaires internes ou externes.Assurer la qualité des informations du système, le référentiel de décisions et l'exactitude de son contenu.Signaler aux fournisseurs toute l'efficacité liée aux informations sur les articles et les prix.Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe de soutien informatique concernée pour parvenir à une résolution.
Section B - Responsabilités générales
Autres
Maintient une connaissance commerciale pertinente des processus de données de référence, des systèmes de MDM et des exigences commerciales.Résoudre les problèmes techniques en établissant un diagnostic ou, le cas échéant, en collaborant avec l'équipe d'assistance informatique concernée pour parvenir à une solution.Participe aux initiatives et aux projets de gestion des données de référence.Agit en tant qu'ambassadeur McKesson des valeurs de l'entreprise.
Section C - Exigences du poste
Éducation
Baccalauréat en commerce ou en administration, gestion des données ou équivalence d'expérience en affaires.
Développement personnel et compétences générales
Bilinguisme (anglais et français) à l'écrit et à l'oral.Leadership démontré.Excellentes compétences en matière de partenariat.Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite.Capacité à interagir avec divers niveaux de gestion et d'employés.
Compétences techniques
Expérience dans les domaines de la gestion des données, de l'analyse et de la création de requêtes, un atout important.Parfaitement bilingue, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral.Maîtrise des systèmes ERP et des systèmes de réapprovisionnement, un atout.Connaissance approfondie des produits MS Office (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project et Visio).Connaissance de SAP (un atout)
Autres compétences et aptitudes
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement dynamique en évolution rapide.Capacité à travailler au sein d'équipes multifonctionnelles.Souci du détail, tout en conservant un sens aigu de la synthèse et une capacité à synthétiser.Capacités d'analyse permettant la création d'un état d'esprit favorisant l'innovation.Esprit d'équipe.Capacité à travailler efficacement avec peu de supervision
Le.la titulaire de ce poste aura à soutenir de façon quotidienne des clients internes et/ou externes à l'extérieur du Québec et/ou aux États-Unis. Par conséquent, ce poste requiert une maîtrise de l'anglais à l'écrit et à l'oral. Veuillez noter que le nombre de postes dont les tâches nécessitent une connaissance de la langue anglaise a été restreint dans la mesure du possible.
_________________________________________________________________________________________________
McKesson is in the business of better health, and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 12 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.
At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Data Management, the Sr. Associate Data Management Analyst assures the quality, consistency, completeness and timeliness of the Master Data information by ensuring the creation and maintenance of the data follows established processes. Their responsibility is to process all Master Data requests and activities across all business units. Performing business process analyses, identifying gaps and inefficiencies, and proposing solutions to help streamline the procedures is expected in this role. This role requires interactions with internal and external stakeholders from various business units.
Section A – Specific Responsibilities
Master Data Management
Acts as the main point of contact for all requests for creation or modification of Master Data.Creates and maintains Master Data in MDM systems.Manages critical information such as contract details, item specifications, pricing, substitutions, discontinuations and data integrity parameters.Creates, analyzes and acts upon various validation reports to ensure control of the Master Data.Works directly with internal and external stakeholders to obtain and validate relevant Master Data information and communicates the required standards and processes, assuring data quality and integrity.Communicates to applicable business partners any relevant information received from internal or external stakeholders.Ensures system information quality, decisions repository and its content accuracy.Reports supplier non-compliance on any inefficiencies related to item and pricing information.Solve technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.
Other
Section B – General Responsibilities
Maintains relevant business knowledge of Master Data processes, MDM systems and business requirements.Solves technical problems by establishing a diagnosis or, where applicable, working with applicable IT Support Team to reach a resolution.Actively participates in master data management initiatives and projects.Acts as a McKesson ambassador of corporate values.
Section C – Position Requirements
Education
Bachelor of Commerce or Administration, Data Management or business experience equivalence.
Personal Development and Soft Skills
Bilingualism (English and French) in writing and speakingDemonstrated leadership.Excellent partnering skills.Excellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to collaborate with various levels of management and employees.
Technical Skills
Experience in the fields of data management, analysis and query creation a strong assetPerfectly bilingual, both written and spoken.Proficiency with ERP systems and replenishment systems an asset.Extensive knowledge of MS Office products (Power Point, Excel, Word, Project and Visio).Knowledge of SAP (an asset)
Other Skills And Capabilities
Ability to work in a rapidly changing dynamic environmentAbility to work as part of multi-functional teams.Attention to detail, whilst maintaining a strong sense of summary and ability to synthesize.Analytical capacities allowing the creation of a state of mind favoring innovationTeam player.Ability to work effectively with little supervision
The incumbent of this position will provide daily support to internal and/or external clients outside Quebec and/or in the United States. Therefore, he/she must be proficient in spoken and written English. Please note that the number of positions requiring English language skills has been limited where possible.
Niveau de carrière – IC – Professionnel – P2

That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. The information on this site is for information purpose only and is not intended to be relied upon with legal consequence.
Current employees must apply through internal career site.
Join us at McKesson!
companyDescription:
At McKesson Canada, our vision is to improve care in every setting — one product, one partner, one patient at a time.

jobDescription:
Job Description

Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.

At Metrolinx, equity, diversity and inclusion are essential to living our values of serving with passion, thinking forward and playing as a team.

Our Rail Business Strategy & Operations Control is seeking a Rail Data Analyst to provide expertise in and coordinate the development and implementation of data management strategies and data collection systems for Rail Services. Identify, analyze and interpret data trends/issues and make recommendations for improvements.

What will I be doing?
 Develops and implements data management strategies and performs data collection including the design and development of relational databases for information management and retrieval that optimize statistical efficiency, data quality and supports evidence-based decision making.  Identifies, analyses, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets using Data Definition Language or Data Manipulation Language commands for data gathering and analysis activities; produces reports and dashboards that identify issues, provide insight into results and outline recommendations for process improvements to resolve operational, business and system issues.  Presents data in dashboards, charts, graphs and/or tables by building, designing and maintaining online applications such as data input/data collection to capture and present reporting, analysis for use by management, internal stakeholders in identifying and implementing process improvements.  Undertake data assurance activities, identifying, investigating and reporting shortfalls in data and data quality and working with data providers and stakeholders to implement remediation activities  Develops and maintains comprehensive data dictionaries, data sets and maintains up to date knowledge of internal data sources relevant to Rail processes and systems  Contributes to the identification and development of new process improvement opportunities for operational, business and systems activities through the development and implementation of data management and collection strategies as well as the analysis of data to support process improvements and evidence-based decision making.  Provides subject matter expertise to internal stakeholders and business units to provide technical advice, assist with data interpretation, needs analysis and provide insight and commentary for decision making purposes. 

What Skills and Qualifications Do I Need?
 University degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related discipline, or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent.  Minimum four (4) years’ experience in a Data Analyst or similar role, with a background in technology, information management, database design and development, business intelligence, data mining or statistics.  Infor EAM experience is highly desirable; Transit or transportation industry experience is preferred.  Knowledge of relational database concepts, database management software and tools and computer applications including MS Office Excel (Pivot tables, Power Pivot, formulas, VBA) and Power BI.  Analytical and problem-solving skills to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with strict attention to detail and accuracy. 

Don’t Meet Every Requirement? 

If you’re excited about working with Metrolinx but your past experience doesn’t quite align with every qualification of this posting, we encourage you to apply. You just might be the right candidate for this or other roles. We are always looking for great talent to join our team.

We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from members of equity-deserving communities, including those who identify as Indigenous, Black, racialized, women, people with disabilities, and people with diverse gender identities, expressions and sexual orientations.

Accommodation

We value the unique skills and experiences each person brings to Metrolinx and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. We are committed to the requirements of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act so if you require accommodation during the hiring process, please let our Recruitment team know by contacting us at: 416-202-5601 or email hr.recruitment@metrolinx.com.

Application Process

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time-sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided is misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.

Metrolinx employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with Metrolinx’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Standard, made under the Metrolinx Communicable Diseases in the Workplace Policy, as a condition of being eligible for the recruitment process. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination will be required. If you are not able to obtain COVID-19 vaccination for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Metrolinx.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

WE ARE AN EQUITABLE AND INCLUSIVE EMPLOYER.
companyDescription:
Metrolinx is undertaking the largest transportation investment in Ontario’s history to get you where you need to go better, faster, easier, while also operating GO Transit, UP Express and PRESTO. Learn more about how we’re connecting communities, building partnerships, and providing you new ways to travel around our region, at Metrolinx.com.
 
Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.

jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leader’s partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Discover opportunities to transform reports into dashboards to deliver more actionable insights and continuously improve the claims analytics environmentGather reporting or dashboarding requirements from stakeholders; steer meetings with data management team to understand data and facilitate meetings with business stakeholders to accurately assess the analytical need for building reports/dashboardsBe passionate and creative in designing analytical wireframes and developing dashboardsRecommend effective visual analytical solutions which drive an analytical mindset within the organizationConduct preliminary analyses on data involving basic statistical approaches and provides solutions to treat various data inconsistencies to support reporting integrityOrganize data for use by other analyst roles and business users within ClaimsSupport the business by developing and providing training and documentation on dashboards
What do you bring to the role?
University degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics, Business, Computer Science, Software Engineering), preferably masters or equivalent experience2-3 years of experience of using Tableau to create dashboards and develop value-creating business insights from operational performance indicators and scorecardsExperience using SQL to transform data from applications to provide summaries and aggregatesExperience with MS Excel required – especially pivot tables, lookups, macros/VBA, PowerPivot, Power QueryKnowledge of big data infrastructure, querying languages and ecosystem (e.g., Impala/Hive)Knowledge of agile methodology for analytics development; experience with JIRA & Confluence an assetExperience in the P&C Insurance industry is a strong assetExcellent communication and organizational skills; comfortable with ambiguity and ability to work independently with minimal supervision
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance

Petline Insurance

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

jobDescription:
WHY JOIN THE TEAM?
To experience exciting challenges and have the opportunity to work at the heart of BRP's transformation, innovation and continuous improvement.You are entrepreneurial, have a strategic vision and wish to support BRP in achieving its growth objectives.To work closely with various multi-disciplinary teams to determine the optimal strategies for the supply chain.You want to be at the very forefront of defining the logistics strategies of a growing multinational company and want to learn the best practices of the manufacturing industry in the area of logistics.
Your Key Responsibilities
Source, clean, and maintain accurate logistics data.Audit logistics data including packaging weight for priority parts in the warehouse.Partner with key internal stakeholders, including the NPD, BI, local, planning, and inbound logistics teams to obtain, synthesize, and present logistics data to relevant audiences.Deliver packaging audits in line with monthly and annual targets, collaborating with local site to secure the support necessary to complete objectives.Correct packaging errors in SAP, according to best practices.Collect weight data according to the priorities given by our transportation provider and internal transportation department.Leverage scheduled assembly line downtimes to advance packaging dimension and weight audits.Support the improvements and implementation of the new Packaging Requirements & Specifications (PRS) document and process with logistics engineering teams.Ensure data is correct in logistic report(s) to improve transportation accuracy.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), communicate the results and, if necessary, make needed corrections to meet project objectives.Support the implementation of a new App and database to improve auditing performance and storage in a database.Promote a spirit of continuous improvement to support our ‘Lean Enterprise’ mission.Work with internal logistics, transportation, and planning to correct and improve data planning parameters and packaging data.Create reports to highlight potential data entry errors.Other duties, as required.
Your Qualifications And Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations Management/Logistics, or other relevant field.Previous relevant experience (logistics, supply chain management, manufacturing operations).English and French fluency required, both written and oral - other language skills (ie. Spanish) a plus.Project management experience.Knowledge of manufacturing operations and logistics (warehousing, transportation, etc.).Strong analysis and problem-solving skills.Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, Power BI, Google suite (including sheets & sites) and other project management software (Smartsheet).The ability to communicate and synthesize complex information to diverse audiences and build ‘executive level’ presentations.Sense of initiative, ability to challenge the status quo, autonomous, organized, and possessing strong attention to detail.Proven interpersonal skills.Accountability for delivering results and achieving objectives.Excellent ability to work in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams.Knowledge of SAP (WM, MM, PP) an asset.Availability to travel, when required.
AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.

Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:
Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered. Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs. Industry leading healthcare: fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.
What About Some Feel Good Extras
Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you. Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.
WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.

 AN EXCEPTIONAL AREA! >
companyDescription:
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, on water, on asphalt or dirt – even in the air.

Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, BRP has been reimagining the way you access your world since 2003 and beyond. Building on a tradition of ingenuity and intense customer focus that go all the way back to 1937, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Austria and Australia. We have a total workforce of more than 14,500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products comprises Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex boats and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts and recreational aircraft. We support our product lines with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business, to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

Follow us /// Suivez-nous:
Facebook: @brpinfo
Twitter: @BRPnews /// @BRPnouvelles 
YouTube: CommunicationsBRP

jobDescription:

jobDescription:
Tourmaline Oil Corp. is a Canadian senior crude oil and natural gas exploration and production company. We are focused on long-term growth through an aggressive exploration, development, production, and acquisition program in the Western Canadian Sedimentary Basin.  We are currently looking for a Completions Data Analyst to join our Calgary office.  PRIMARY FOCUS
The Completions Analyst is responsible for providing analytical and administrative support to the Completions team. The primary focus will be ensuring high quality data is being entered into our well lifecycle platform and using that dataset to help drive business decisions.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Work with the field and office staff to ensure high quality data in WellmanWork with the Completions and Wellman team to make improvements to the platformPont of contact for Wellman related questions for the Completions teamPoint of contact for the Water Tracking App for the Completions teamComplete a month end data scrub to ensure all completed wells comply with Tourmaline data requirements (start/end dates, cost tracking, frac data and water usage)Work with the Completions manager to analyze frac cost and evaluate price proposalsSupport the Completions team with excel tracking and eliminate waste in workflowsSupport the Operations Data Analyst in preparing data for Power BI reports when requested 
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 3 years of analyst experience, preferably in the oil and gas industryUniversity degree or technical diploma in a related disciplineField experience is considered an asset but not requiredCompetency in Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPointAdvanced with Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables and basic formulas required)Power BI experience is considered an asset but not requiredAbility to work independently within a dynamic work environment is essential; can function well with little direction Proactive and self-motivatedAttentive to detailAdaptable and able to work within deadlines, works well under pressure
companyDescription:
Tourmaline Oil Corp. is a Canadian intermediate crude oil and natural gas exploration and production company focused on long-term growth through an aggressive exploration, development, production and acquisition program in the Western Canadian Sedimentary Basin. 

Tourmaline commenced active operations in the fall of 2008 with the objective of building a successful Canadian intermediate crude oil and natural gas exploration, development and production company with a long-term business strategy similar to that of Duvernay Oil Corp. and Berkley Petroleum Corp., companies previously founded and managed by certain key members of Tourmaline’s senior management team. During the two-year period since commencing active operations, Tourmaline, through a series of strategic acquisitions, farm-ins and land acquisitions combined with its active capital exploration and development program, has assembled an extensive undeveloped land position with a large, multi-year drilling inventory and operating control of important natural gas processing and transportation infrastructure in two core long-term growth areas – the Alberta Deep Basin and the Greater Peace River High. Tourmaline is executing a large-scale, repeatable capital exploration and development program in these two core long-term growth areas.

Tourmaline’s long-term business strategy is to increase shareholder value by building an extensive asset base over two to three core exploration and production areas and exploiting and developing these areas to increase reserves, production and cash flows at an attractive return on invested capital.

jobDescription:
Who We AreOlympic Industries ULC is a leading international forest products trading company with annual revenue exceeding $500 million. Our expertise includes the trading, importing/exporting, and manufacturing of forest products. 
Established in 1972, we have a strong record of success and a clear vision for our industry's sustainable future. Our office is located in the heart of the vibrant and breathtaking Lonsdale Quay. OpportunityOlympic Industries is currently searching for a highly motivated and passionate Derivatives and Data Analyst to join our growth-oriented team! 
Reporting to the Head of Data & Derivatives, the Derivatives & Data Analyst will work both in individual and team capacity to facilitate data operations and risk management across all derivative trading activities. 
Specific Responsibilities Automating day-to-day operation tasks with derivative trading such as sending fills, reconciling, mark-to-market and building new system for the new Lumber Futures Contract. Sourcing important and available public/proprietary data to may be relevant to trading and managing risks. Building and maintaining Dashboards on Google Sheet and Power BI.Building and improving theorical pricing and risk models. Ensuring derivatives data integrity and accuracy. Education and ExperienceAn academic background in Finance, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, or related field. 1+ years of experience with Advanced Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets. Experience or basic knowledge in PowerBI. Experience in basic scripting languages, preferably Python.Experience or basic knowledge in writing SQL queries and working with databases, such as MSSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL and MongoDB.Basic understanding of futures and options. Passion for capital markets and risk management with big data.Knowledge in machine learning, data mining, statistical modelling, and forecasting considered an asset.Knowledge of microstructure and theories of the derivatives market considered an asset, e.g. Options Greeks, Volatility/Forward Curve Modelling, Delta/Optimal Hedging, Over-The-Counter (OTC) Derivatives. CompetenciesProven ability to complete work in a timely manner with exceptional accuracy and attention to detail.Ability to prioritize in a fast moving, high pressure, constantly changing environment.Outstanding verbal, written and visual communication skills.A high degree of initiative, work ethic, integrity, and honesty.Ability to listen and understand instructions and work independently or with others to complete tasks.Ability to use strong judgement in analyzing, troubleshooting, and evaluating problems.Ability to act with good judgement and discretion: keeping sensitive business data secure.Desire and capacity to acquire new knowledge and develop new skills, specifically in the commodities trading industry.Ability to conduct research into systems issues as required. High-energy with an entrepreneurial spirit. Why Join Us?Work hard, play hard company culture.Employee stock ownership plan.RRSP Contribution Plan.Extended health benefits.Life insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance. Long-term disability insurance.Employee assistance and scholarship programs.On-site gym and showers.On-site kitchen with a Nespresso coffee bar.Easy access to the mountains and oceans. Apply Now!For more information on Olympic Industries, please visit our website at www.olympicind.com. To apply, please submit a resume in confidence to careers@olympicind.com and follow our company page on LinkedIn.  We thank all applicants for their interest! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. At Olympic Industries, we embrace diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
companyDescription:
Olympic Industries was established in 1972 as the Canadian arm of the Forest City Trading Group.  Ideally situated in North Vancouver, British Columbia, we have direct access to producing sawmills and international logistics lanes delivering value to our customers that is second to none in the industry.

As the global demand for forest products has increased, Olympic has become a force in international markets. Our four departments consist of:

1. North American Trading; our 900+ customers consist of distribution, national pro-dealers, retail, multifamily, industrial, and manufacturing. 

2. Manufacturing; our manufacturing team has been producing finished cedar, specialty pine and SPF products for over 30 years.

3. Export; our lumber and logs exports (container, partial cargo, breakbulk vessel) reach 10+ countries on 3 continents. 

4. European Import; our import lumber is sourced from several European sawmills to 7 North American reload locations. 

Olympic is an industry leader with annual sales of over $500 million and 30 active traders in house. Our goal is to minimize risk through on-the-ground inventory, forward pricing, and custom solutions. We leverage the information obtained from access to all major global regions to enhance your trading returns.

With a corporate culture that rewards hard work, entrepreneurship, and team collaboration, we are here to help you. Call us today to see learn more.
