Learn more about the City of Hamilton's 2016-2025 Strategic Plan here:
https://www.hamilton.ca/city-initiatives/priority-projects/2016-2025-strategic-plan.

CITY OF HAMILTON LAND ACKNOWLEDGMENT
The City of Hamilton is situated upon the traditional territories of the Erie, Neutral, Huron-Wendat, Haudenosaunee and Mississaugas. This land is covered by the Dish With One Spoon Wampum Belt Covenant, which was an agreement between the Haudenosaunee and Anishinaabek to share and care for the resources around the Great Lakes. We further acknowledge that this land is covered by the Between the Lakes Purchase, 1792, between the Crown and the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation.

Today, the City of Hamilton is home to many Indigenous people from across Turtle Island (North America) and we recognize that we must do more to learn about the rich history of this land so that we can better understand our roles as residents, neighbours, partners and caretakers.

jobDescription:
Overview
White Star Capital is a global technology investment firm partnering with exceptional founders building the companies of tomorrow. With offices in North America, Europe, and Asia, our presence, perspective and deep operational expertise enables us to partner with founders to help them scale globally from early stage onwards.
White Star Capital is looking for a Data Analyst to join the Data and Technology team in North America. The Data Analyst will play an essential role in the development of White Star Capital’s technology stack and long-term technology-enabled strategy. The candidate will be an integral part of the execution and build-out of White Star Capital’s data and technology systems, and will support White Star Capital’s growth as a world class data-driven decision-making organization.
The ideal candidate will use their passion for analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for internal and external stakeholders.  ResponsibilitiesAssist with the design and architecture of key strategic technologies for the broader Investment and Finance teamHelp identify and implement solutions which improve efficiency and effectiveness through the elimination, simplification, and automation of processesAssist with technology solution initiative and implementation of new systems such as Salesforce, TableauSupport the development of financial reports and calculating portfolio valuation metrics for General and Limited Partner reportingWork closely with the Technology and Finance teams on design and implementation of robust data upload processes, system-based quality checks, internal controls, and exception handling.Oversee integrations between external and internal systems, leveraging API technologies and SFTP connectionsDevelop tools for internal knowledge share such as charts and dashboards (using Tableau), ensuring data completeness and processes for error investigation and resolution with internal teams.Work ad-hoc with large datasets of underlying portfolio data to monitor performance and derive actionable insights to achieve key portfolio objectivesPartner with the Technology team to automate existing reports and develop new reporting and analytics that leverage White Star Capital’s cloud database and analytical tools (Excel, Python, SQL, Tableau, etc.)Contribute innovative ideas towards future White Star Capital strategic initiativesParticipate in team meetings and other firm-wide initiatives to share insights gained from analysis
Qualifications3-5 years of relevant experience in a data-related positionHigh level of proficiency in Excel and complex financial modelling skills as well as coding experience in Python or other relevant programming languagesExperience with Salesforce is a bonus Strong working knowledge of venture capital and data concepts Experience working on teams that manage multiple stakeholders, advisors, and work streamsHighly effective communicator, including experience distilling complex topics into clear, concise presentation materials and confidence in presenting to different stakeholder groups Deeply curious, with a desire to understand and learn complex financial structures Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in work output Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure Willingness to work across the organization in support of ad hoc projects as required Team player who enjoys a high-performance culture
We are looking for candidates based near one of White Star Capital’s offices in North America (Toronto, Montreal, or New York). We have a flexible work from home policy but the candidate will be required to come to the office from time to time.
For interest, please apply here. If you have examples or links to work you have done please do feel free to share. Application deadline: December 31st, 2022, but reviewed on a rolling basis
Building diverse teams is one of our core values at White Star Capital. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including but not limited to race, ethnicity, religion, gender and sexual orientation.
companyDescription:
White Star Capital is a global multi-stage investment platform built by a team of founders, investors and operators with a track record of entering new markets, expanding teams and exiting companies.

Our approach to venture is characterized by a unique combination of international presence, perspective and people. 

With feet on the ground in New York, London, Montreal, Paris, Tokyo, Hong Kong, and Singapore, we partner closely with our portfolio to help them scale internationally from Series A onwards.

jobDescription:
iA Groupe financier est à constituer une équipe dynamique et innovatrice en matière de gestion de données qui saura mettre en place les assises pour la transformation numérique de l’entreprise afin de devenir Data Driven.

Les données vous passionnent ? Vous souhaitez avoir un rôle de leadership tout en étant responsable de la livraison de solutions en intelligence d’affaire et intelligence artificielle auprès de plusieurs secteurs d’affaires ? Nous avons une opportunité à votre hauteur.

Ce poste aura plusieurs défis stimulants, dont la responsabilité de proposer et mettre en œuvre des solutions innovantes afin d’améliorer l’accès et la disponibilité à l’information financière (principalement). Il aura aussi la responsabilité d’optimiser l’utilisation des systèmes de gestion de données auprès des différentes équipes.
L’analyste en données – ingénierie de données, contribue à la mise en place et à l’évolution des jeux de données et des solutions corporatives de gestion des données tels que les entrepôts et comptoirs de données, des solutions d’intégration, d’ingestion et de visualisation de données.

L’analyste de données est responsable de la définition, de la documentation et du suivi des exigences en matière de solutions de données de l’organisation. Il doit s’assurer de la compréhension des besoins d’affaires en lien avec les solutions qu’il supporte. Il doit coordonner la formalisation et la mise en place des règles d’affaires visant à assurer l'exactitude, l'exhaustivité, la cohérence et la conformité des données en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise. L’analyste données est aussi responsable de s’assurer que les plateformes logicielles supportant les solutions de données sont déployées et évoluent en fonction des besoins de l’organisation.
Responsabilités spécifiques
Construire des solutions de données collectant des données de plusieurs sources de données, puis les enrichissant et les exposant pour les utilisateursRéaliser les explorations de données en amont de la réalisation des solutions des donnéesConstruire des flux de chargement de données ETL/ELT afin d’intégrer, transformer et exposer les donnéesMettre en œuvre les scénarios de tests fonctionnels et systèmes intégrés durant la modification des applications, pour garantir l’intégrité opérationnelle des solutions de données corporatives, réaliser les essais unitaires, fonctionnels et de non-régressionSupporter le partenaire d'affaires au cours des essais d’acceptationAssurer le support des solutions de données en productionRéaliser des extractions de données pour l’équipe affairesParticiper aux cérémonies SAFe agiles tel que : Les planification de PI, les Scrums quotidiens, les planifications de sprint, les démonstrations de fin de sprint, etc.Superviser la mise en production itérative des solutions, travailler avec des équipes des différentes unités d’affaires pour établir et exécuter les tâches nécessaires, selon un ordre bien établi.
Autres responsabilités
Promouvoir la réutilisation des composants existants, participer au choix de progiciels, services ou de composants externes (ex. en infonuagique) et en dernier ressort, recommander la construction en interne lorsque requise (REUSE, BUY, BUILD).Travailler en collaboration avec les différents intervenants Affaires et TI dans le but de concevoir des composants qui respectent les orientations de l’entreprise, sont viables, efficaces et rentables.
Profil technique recherché
Baccalauréat en informatique, informatique de gestion, systèmes d’information, génie informatique ou logiciel, toute autre formation pertinente de même niveauPlus de 5 ans d’expérience en technologies de l’information, dont 3 ans d’expérience pertinentes pour le posteExpérience dans la réalisation d’entrepôts de données et de solutions d’intelligence d’affaires (SQL Server, SSIS, PowerBI, Snowflake, Databricks, Azure Data Factory,)Bonnes connaissances des outils de chargement de données ETL/ELTMaitrise du langage SQL et connaissance de l’outil d’intégration de données SSISMaîtrise des techniques, cadres de référence et méthodologies propres à son domaine d’expertise (SAFe®, Agile, DevOps, Software Development Lifecycle, etc.)Connaissance de l’industrie de l’assurance et des services financiers (atout)
Profil de compétences
Excellent communicateur, structuré et vulgarisateur technique possédant un bon esprit de synthèse et sachant travailler efficacement en équipe.Leader naturel avec une capacité d’influencer et d’orienter les autres, particulièrement au niveau des équipes de livraison de solutions et des collaborateurs en périphérie de son champ d’action.Grande capacité d’identification et de résolution de problèmes.Excellentes aptitudes à la coordination, à la négociation et à la prise de décision
*Veuillez noter que le titre à l'interne sera Analyste en données*
companyDescription: iA Financial Group is one of the largest insurance and wealth management groups in Canada, with operations in the United States. Founded in 1892, it is an important Canadian public company and is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the ticker symbols IAG (common shares) and IAF (preferred shares).

jobDescription:
Responsibilities
The Quantitative Advisor will execute independent review of business models under both US and Canada regulations working closely with cross functional teams, including business stakeholders, model developer, model validators (Paris and NY office), IT, auditors. Presentation of validation analysis to senior management is in the scope of this role. He/she will be exposed to a variety of models used by the business and support functions, including models for credit risk, market risk, counterparty risk, stress testing, margining, IFRS9, trading algorithms and financial crime compliance.
In collaboration with Senior Quantitative Advisors and the team Manager, the JQuantitative Advisor will: Conduct independent model review of relevant models that are employed in SG Americas at all stages of their lifecycle by:Assessing model conceptual soundness to ensure the consistency of model design by performing quantitative analyses and statistical tests, developing challenger models for benchmark, reviewing model development processes, and challenging the theoretical aspects considering published research and industry practice; Working with large, complex datasets to verify data input quality and processing (feeding, transformation), model output accuracy, and employ advanced statistical techniques to work with sparse datasets;Assessing data quality and consistency between data characteristics and modeling assumptions;Replicating and review model architecture to verify the computation accuracy of a model and ensure the model is implemented as designed and all model components are functioning as intendedAnalyzing model output through backtesting, benchmarking, sensitivity analysis by using quantitative tools and techniques; Assessing the model use to ensure it is aligned with the intended purpose by identifying and reviewing model output production, usage, reporting, and business processes; Reviewing model ongoing monitoring to ensure that model is performing as intended by evaluating whether changes in products, exposures, activities, clients, or market conditions necessitate adjustment, redevelopment, or replacement of the model. Verify the model performance over time and ensure that model limitations are assessed; Conducting and interpreting 2LOD model monitoring;Assessing model governance aspects such as model change management, ongoing monitoring, and model risk assessment; Evaluate overall model risk, report findings and propose recommendations of remediation. Draft comprehensive validation documents and prepare model review materials for MRM management and committees, RISQ management, and model and business partners; Maintain positive relationships and continuous communication with model and business stakeholders;Candidate must be able to communicate model review outcomes (and intermediate feedback) verbally – not only in validation report (mentioned above); Work with front office, model developers and risk managers with day-to-day model review and remediation follow-up.
Profile Required
Requirements for the Quantitative Advisor:
Minimum of a Bachelors Degree (Master and PhD preferred) in a quantitative area: Mathematical Finance, Financial Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics; 3 years of experience in Model Development or Validation in finance/risk management, or Front Office Quant role. Fewer years of relevant experience will be considered for candidates with a PhD degree; Excellent quantitative programming skills in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, R, C++, SAS, Matlab); Advanced knowledge of statistics, econometrics, machine learning;Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work with quant or non-quant staffs; Awareness of model risk management and associated regulatory requirements;Team-oriented with a keen sense of ownership and accountability; Project and time management skills to work in a multi-tasking working environment; Experience with various quantitative models in areas of Market Risk, Credit Risk, Operational Risk and PPNR is a plus; Experience in large data management and quantitative analysis is a plus; Bilingual (English and French) is a plus; FRM or other Risk Management certifications is a plus; PhD is a plus. 
 Business insight
Société Générale (SG) is multinational banking and financial services company providing services worldwide in 67 countries. Founded in 1864 and headquartered in Paris, SG is France’s third largest bank by total assets. As a global bank, SG core businesses cover Retail Banking in France (Société Générale), International Banking and Financial Services (IBFS), and Corporate and Investment Banking (SG CIB). SG group reported 2017 operating income of € 4.76 billion, total assets € 1.27 trillion. Team spirit, Innovation, Responsibility, and Commitment – the values upon which SG was founded – have guided the company’s actions for over 150 years.
Conformément son engagement à fournir un milieu de travail sécuritaire pour toute personne accédant à ses installations, à compter du 15 novembre 2021, en vertu de la politique de vaccination contre la Covid-19 Société Générale Canada, seuls les employés pleinement vaccinés seront autorisés à venir au bureau de Montréal et de Toronto 
In accordance with its commitment to provide a safe work environment for anyone accessing its facilities, as of November 15, 2021, under Societe Generale Canada's Covid-19 vaccination policy, only fully vaccinated employees will be allowed to come to the Montreal and Toronto offices.

Description

At Neo, we’re disrupting the future of finance. What matters most to us is challenging the status quo and providing a better financial future for all Canadians. We’re working everyday to reinvent the way Canadians spend, save, and grow their money - all together, in one place. We’re creating a seamless digital experience, with the modern day features you’ve come to expect. Our products speak for themselves - the Neo card was voted best cash back card in Canada and the Neo Money account was voted best bank account in Canada.

Backed by world class investors, we’ve raised $299M and are one of a few Canadian tech companies that have reached ‘unicorn’ status - valued over $1B. Check out the full story here.

The Role:

Neo Financial is looking for an experienced and data-driven individual to join our team as a full-time Business Intelligence Specialist in our downtown Calgary headquarters. In this role, you will be responsible for developing a deep understanding of our Neo customers and how we can continue to improve value to our customers through the use of data driven insights. Our team navigates through a fast-paced environment and knows how to switch gears to adapt to any scenario. If you're a motivated leader who wants to make things better, simpler and stronger; you'll fit right in with this team. If this sounds like you, come make your mark with transformative products and technologies, alongside some of Canada's most successful leaders and tech minds.

What you will be doing:
Develop a deep understanding of customer related product and operational flows, and customer engagement methodsContinuously evolve our understanding of how we provide value to our customers, and how we can continue to improve those levers through the use of data driven insightsWork closely with operational teams to understand business requirements, and how to best leverage insights to improve operationsPartner with data engineering and advanced analytics teams to understand the data environment to ensure insights are accurate, and meaningful for end stakeholders Stay current on automated monitoring and metrics that come from production systems that may indicate customer healthOwn daily, weekly, and monthly system performance management, holding internal teams accountable within their performance expectations Write detailed reports and summarize findings for stakeholders on the health of our customer base

Who we are looking for:
You bring 3+ years of experience working with large data sets in a business-oriented environmentYou are obsessed with using data to inform understanding of business issues and opportunities, and can translate that data to recommendations that deliver business outcomesYou have a strong expertise with spreadsheets and creating ad-hoc reportsYou’re highly proficient with BI platforms and data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Domo, Qlik, etc.)You have experience using SQL for data processing and DatabricksYou’re a motivated hustler who can deal with ambiguity, dig into any problem, and troubleshoot any kind of technical issueYou have a highly analytical mindset that can find patterns, trace through calculations and process through large data setsYou bring experience translating between business and technical stakeholdersYou have great verbal and written communicators, including technical writing and the ability to debate or talk through complex scenariosYou bring strong attention to detail, grit, perseverance, organization and a thirst for learning are criticalA post-secondary degree in Engineering, Science, Business or a similar field is an asset

What will help you succeed: 
You are intellectually curious, and won’t stop investigating a problem until you have identified the root causesYou are a structured and logical thinker, capable of taking a problem and breaking it down into its component partsYou’re passionate about building world-class products with a world-class team

About applying with us:

At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and redefines Canada’s financial future. It’s a serious deal, and we’re building a high performance, mission-driven, and fast-paced team that strives to make a difference in every Canadian's life. We value personal growth, autonomy, leadership at all levels, and the ability to learn quickly from mistakes. We’re a team: in it together, always. Join a world class team building truly disruptive technology, right here in the Canadian prairies.

Benefits of working at Neo:

Flexible Compensation Scenarios - the ability to choose your base salary and equity combination

Meaningful Equity - employees are owners. When the company succeeds, you do too

Extended Health Benefits - comprehensive health and dental coverage that starts on day one

Wellness Benefits - complimentary access to Headspace and FitOn Pro subscriptions

Paid Maternity & Parental Leave - company top-up and 100% benefits coverage while you’re away

Modern Office Space - our newly renovated headquarters in Calgary and Winnipeg is prime for collaboration and innovation

Learning Events - all-company huddles, product demo days, guest speakers, and more

Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.
companyDescription:
Reimagining the way Canadians manage their money with tech-first financial tools to spend, save, invest and more in the digital age.

We're looking for passionate, talented, driven people to be part of our founding team and help re-shape the world of finance.

jobTitle: Analyste principal.e – Changements climatiques et analyse de cycle de vie
jobDescription:
Groupe AGÉCO se compose de professionnelles et professionnels multidisciplinaires qui unissent leur cerveau pour répondre aux besoins des organisations en matière de responsabilité d’entreprise. Pour y arriver, nous misons sur la collaboration, la rigueur, la créativité et l’innovation.À l’aise avec la réalisation de bilans GES et motivé(e) à l’idée d’accompagner des organisations dans l’amélioration de leurs performances en matière de lutte aux changements climatiques : c’est toi qu’on cherche!
Tu te reconnais ?Bonne capacité relationnelle pour entretenir des liens avec tes collègues et les clientsCapacité à communiquer les résultats en statistiques, en recommandations et en actions concrètesParcours académique en ingénierie ou en science de l’environnement7 ans d’expérience dans le domaine des changements climatiques et/ou de l’analyse cycle de vie environnementaleExpérience en gestion de projetsMaitrise de l’anglais et du français à l’oral et à l’écritMaitrise de la suite OfficeConnaissances appliquées à divers logiciels d’analyse de données (ex. VBA pour Excel, SimaPro, OpenLCA, ATHENA, etc.)
Un défi stimulant pour toi :
Relevant de la vice-présidence du service de la responsabilité d’entreprise, la personne titulaire du poste sera principalement responsable de la réalisation d’analyses de cycle de vie, d’analyses de risques climatiques et de bilans GES.
L’analyste principal.e doit collaborer avec les autres membres des équipes projet pour :Cibler et collecter les données pertinentes à la réalisation du mandatAnalyser les données à l’aide de programmes informatiquesÉtablir des objectifs de réduction des impacts climatiques basés sur la scienceAssurer la bonne gestion du projet (interne et externe)Soutenir les analystes juniors dans la réalisation de leurs mandatsDemeurer à l’affût de nouveaux développements méthodologiques et des connaissances en matière de changements climatiquesFormuler des recommandations stratégiques basées sur des interprétations poussées des résultats obtenusOffrir des conseils stratégiques concernant les certifications et les méthodes de compensation carboneRédiger des rapports et préparer des présentations adaptées aux clients et aux besoins définis dans le cadre du mandatProcéder aux redditions de compte auprès de programmes reconnus (GRI, CDP, MSCI, EcoVadis, CSA, etc.)Représenter Groupe AGÉCO lors d’événement
Les avantages de travailler avec nous :
Chez AGÉCO, la vie de bureau c’est important — télétravail ou pas. En plus d’offrir un environnement de travail bienveillant où l’humour et les relations humaines sont primordiaux, nous offrons :Des opportunités de développement professionnel stimulantesUne politique de rémunération agile et compétitiveDeux espaces de travail fixes situés à Québec et à MontréalUn horaire flexible et une politique de télétravailDes assurances collectivesUn bonus annuelPlusieurs activités ponctuelles pour stimuler l’esprit d’équipe
Pour soumettre ta candidature :
Si cette offre t’interpelle, fais-nous parvenir ton CV ainsi qu’une lettre de présentation par courriel à ageco@groupeageco.ca
companyDescription:
Groupe AGÉCO est actif depuis maintenant 20 ans dans les domaines de l’économie agroalimentaire et de la responsabilité d’entreprise. Nous aidons nos clients à prendre de bonnes décisions leur permettant de tirer profit de leur environnement d’affaires.

Pionnier au Québec dans la consultation appliquée au secteur agroalimentaire, Groupe AGÉCO a aussi participé activement au développement d’outils de mise en œuvre du développement durable. L’acquisition des activités de Quantis Canada en mars 2015 a permis au Groupe AGÉCO d’élargir son offre de services en responsabilité d’entreprise, couvrant maintenant à la fois les dimensions sociale, économique et environnementale.

jobDescription:
Titre: Analyst, Master DataLocation: Montreal Reports to: Applications Data Manager
Overview
Reporting to the Applications & Master Data Manager, this role will have key responsibilities creating and maintaining new and existing master data records. As well as, provide analytical assistance to Inside Sales, Production and Planning, Accounts Payables and converting mills to ensure quality and availability of information for both daily operations and projects. This role also involves identifying inconsistencies in data; gaps in processes and possessing the desire to effectively improve business by seeking solutions and offering alternatives.
One who can effectively communicate with members of the Applications Data and Master Data teams as well as understand the usage of business meanings and application of the data.
Job Responsibilities/Accountabilities
Manage business requests for new and existing master data records in JDE, Baan and SAP systems.Identify data errors or inconsistencies in customer, supplier and item data; gaps in processes and understand proposed solutions.Perform routine data checks on existing transactions. Analyze data quality.Collaborate with team on issues and solutions.Perform testing in ERP for application changes. Develop and present training to new Data Management employees. Support implementation of tools or procedures that improve current processes and cause no negative impact.Act as a human interface between Inside Sales and IT on master data changes and enhancements.Ensure effective usage and adherence to regulations and guidelines set out for master data maintenance.
Key Skill Sets
Demonstrates excellent communication skills, both written and verbalDemonstrates successfully working independently and as a member of a teamDemonstrates organizational skills and the ability to meet deadlinesDemonstrates leadership skills
Required Professional Experience/Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred and/or equivalent experience.Industry and product knowledge helpful or a minimum of 2 years experience in a Business to Business sales environment.Successful candidate will possess good communication, listening and interpersonal skills.Must be proficient in various software application programs including Microsoft Office utilities. ERP systems knowledge such as SAP, Baan or JDE preferred.
You must successfully complete a selection process that includes interviews, aptitude tests (for some positions) 
Domtar is an equal opportunity employer. We invite women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.
Our Offer
Alternative Work Arrangements; hybrid or remote work and flextimeA flexible insurance plan (life, medical, dental);An employee assistance program;A childcare center on location;Competitive compensation, including annual bonus plan;A pension plan with matching company contributions;Employer-paid development and continuing education.
companyDescription:
Domtar makes products that people around the world rely on every day. We design, manufacture, market and distribute a wide variety of fiber-based products including communication, specialty and packaging papers, market pulp and airlaid nonwovens. With approximately 6,000 employees serving more than 50 countries around the world, Domtar is driven by a commitment to turn sustainable wood fiber into useful products that people rely on every day. Domtar’s principal executive office is in Fort Mill, South Carolina and Domtar is part of the Paper Excellence group of companies.

But how we do things is as important as what we do. In every industry we serve, we continually find ways to do a better job. Develop a better product. Improve a manufacturing process. Manage natural resources responsibly and make the best use of every asset we have. We work efficiently, lead quietly and let our products and customer service do the talking. 

Throughout our history, we’ve relied on our agility to meet the demands of an evolving world. Today, our spirit of innovation drives deliberate improvement and our commitment to caring runs deep. We constantly find better way to serve our customers, support our employees and strengthen our communities. It’s just our way of doing things.

jobDescription:

DIRECTION DE LA SANTÉ NUMÉRIQUE

Description
QUI SOMMES NOUS
Regroupant une grande variété d’établissements de santé affiliés à des universités dans le centre-ouest de Montréal, dont des hôpitaux, des centres de soins de longue durée et des CLSC, le Centre intégré universitaire de santé et de services sociaux (CIUSSS) du Centre-Ouest-de-l’Île-de-Montréal offre des possibilités infinies.
Au sein de ce réseau, vous serez appelé à jouer un rôle de premier plan dans le soutien des continuums et trajectoires de soins pour les clients au sein d’établissements ayant reçu des mentions d’honneur et reconnus à travers le monde pour la qualité des soins et la recherche. Au CIUSSS, les membres du personnel sont au cœur du réseau. S’appuyant sur des valeurs de compassion et d’intégrité, le CIUSSS se distingue par son statut bilingue et sa riche identité culturelle.
Description
Le Centre universitaire intégré de santé et de services sociaux de la Santé du Centre-Ouest de Montréal est actuellement à la recherche de candidats pour combler le poste d'analyste informatique (spécialiste en ingénierie des données) à la Direction de la santé numérique. Notre établissement comprend plus de 30 sites, avec un budget de 850 millions de dollars pour les activités de fonctionnement incluant les activités principales et périphériques.
PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS
Nous Recherchons Une Personne Ayant Des Compétences Démontrées En Ingénierie Des Données Pour Nous Aider à
développer, concevoir, maintenir et utiliser un entrepôt de données d’entreprise et les flux de données nécessaires pour l’alimenter.
Cet entrepôt de données comprendra les données de soins de santé des centaines de milliers de patients traités par notre organisation, ainsi que les données opérationnelles nécessaires pour soutenir nos opérations de soins de santé. Le(la) candidat(e) retenu(e) travaillera au sein d’une équipe spécialisée pour développer et exploiter cette infrastructure et aura ainsi l’occasion de contribuer de manière significative à l’amélioration de la santé de centaines de milliers de patients.
Cet entrepôt de données servira à son tour à intégrer, organiser et analyser les données collectées par notre organisation multi-missions. La personne retenue est un(e) professionnel(le) hautement crédible, organisé(e) et expérimenté(e) avec un grand sens de l'esprit d'équipe. Communicateur(trice) efficace, le(la) candidat(e) retenu(e) agira avec rigueur et démontrera des normes éthiques élevées.
L'analyste en informatique remplira ses fonctions à temps plein.
Exigences
PROFIL ACADÉMIQUE
 Détenir un baccalauréat en informatique ou dans une autre discipline universitaire appropriée.
CONNAISSANCES ET COMPÉTENCES RECHERCHÉES
 Un minimum d'un (1) d’expérience de travail dans un rôle d’ingénierie de données; Expérience de la conception, de la mise en œuvre, de la gestion et de l’interrogation de grandes bases de données - idéalement, cela comprendrait une expérience avec des systèmes de gestion de bases de données relationnelles, graphiques et de valeurs clés un avantage; Connaissances et expérience dans la connectivité de base de données, y compris ETL, ELT, XML, JSON - idéalement, cela inclurait l’expérience avec HL7 2, HL7 FHIR, OMOP CDM, i2b2 et un outil ELT tel que Talend; Connaissances et expérience dans le nettoyage et l’harmonisation des données des systèmes sources dans un environnement multilingue; Compétences démontrées avec les scripts et autres langages de programmation (sur et en dehors de la machine virtuelle Java), y compris Python ou, R et Java ou Kotlin; Expérience dans la mise en place et la maintenance d’interfaces utilisateur interactives pour faciliter l’accès aux données et à l’analyse; Expérience de travail avec les systèmes de collaboration et la gestion des versions (git ou autre); Bilingue (anglais et français).
AVANTAGES SOCIAUX ET CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL
 Horaire flexible Possibilités de travailler en mode hybride (télétravail et présentiel) Flexibilité sur le plan des vacances Différents congés sociaux, maternité, paternité, parental, études, etc Programme gratuit d’aide aux employés (PAE) Facilement accessible par transport en commun 20 jours de vacances après un (1) an travaillé 13 congés fériés 9,6 jours de maladie monnayable une fois l'an Programme de rabais aux employés Régime d'assurance-collective Régime de retraite (RREGOP)
INFORMATIONS ADDITIONNELLES
 Pour un diplôme obtenu hors Québec, nous exigeons l’Évaluation comparative des études émise par le ministère compétent. De plus, nous considérons aussi les expériences acquises hors Québec.
DIVERSITÉ ET INCLUSION
Au CIUSSS du Centre-Ouest-de-l ’Ile-de-Montréal, la diversité est au cœur de qui nous sommes et de ce que nous faisons, tous les jours. Nous sommes fiers d’accueillir, de valoriser et de faire rayonner cette diversité dans toutes nos équipes, composées d’individus possédant des forces, des expériences et des parcours différents, ayant tous une passion pour l'excellence des soins et services visant l’amélioration de la vie des gens. Nous travaillons à offrir des environnements de travail et d’apprentissage exemplaires et de qualité supérieure qui sont sains, équitables et inclusifs, exempts de toute forme de discrimination et où chaque personne est accueillie et reconnue peu importe ses identités, et est également partie prenante et contributrice au présent et au futur du CIUSSS.
Nous souscrivons fièrement au programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi (PAÉE) et invitons les candidatures des femmes, des membres d’une minorité visible ou ethnique, des Autochtones et des personnes présentant des limitations, sans distinction de race, d'origine nationale ou ethnique, de couleur, de religion, d'âge, de sexe, d'orientation sexuelle, d'identité ou d'expression de genre, d’état matrimonial, de situation de famille ou tout autre motif légalement protégé. Nous invitons toute personne ayant besoin d’accommodements à n’importe laquelle des étapes du processus de recrutement, à communiquer avec nous en toute confidentialité à l’adresse courriel recrutement.ccomtl@ssss.gouv.qc.ca
Remarques
Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais ne communiquerons qu’avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.
Si votre expérience professionnelle a évolué depuis votre dernière visite, nous vous invitons à joindre votre curriculum vitae afin de faire valoir l'ensemble de votre cheminement professionnel.
Si vous postulez d'un appareil mobile (téléphone intelligent, tablette), vous recevrez un courriel d'accusé réception vous demandant d'aller mettre à jour votre CV afin que votre candidature soit prise en considération. Nous vous invitons à vérifier vos courriels indésirables (un courriel de notre organisation pourrait s'y trouver).
companyDescription: The Integrated Health and Social Services University Network for West-Central Montreal (CIUSSS West-Central Montreal) is committed to providing healthcare recipients with timely access to a seamless continuum of care that focuses on individuals’ particular needs. The area covered by this network is home to approximately 345,000 people, who are served by more than 30 member facilities. Included are one of Montreal’s leading hospitals (the Jewish General Hospital) and an interlocking array of three specialized hospitals, five CLSCs, two rehabilitation centres, seven long-term care sites, two day centres and several affiliated research facilities. Treatment and care are provided by a staff of more than 12,000, and over 600 doctors.

jobDescription:
Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team that is reshaping health care shared services andhow they are delivered? Mohawk Medbuy is a national not for profit shared service organization trusted by Canadian hospitals and other health care providers to deliver exceptional value, innovation, and support in raising the standard of patient care. Working as an extension of our Member organizations, we provide end-to-end supply chain, clinical and back-office services driven by collaboration and operational excellence. Through our clinical expertise and strategic data analysis, we source and deliver insights and solutions that address the challenges faced by health care providers - yielding efficiencies and cost savings that allow them to invest in and focus on improving the patient experience. Mohawk Medbuy’s strength as an organization comes from our employees’ knowledge, skill, and commitment to providing our customers with the highest standards of quality service to assist them in delivering exceptional patient care.We are currently recruiting for a full-time Technical Spend Analytics Analyst to support ourSpend Analytics team.
POSITION OVERVIEWIf you have a passion for working with raw data and turning it into actionable insights, this mightbe the job for you! This position is responsible for maintaining data governance and data quality which impacts reports that are used internally across the organization and by our external stakeholders to make financial decisions.
Key ResponsibilitiesReview data gaps from overnight ETL process and process accordinglyValidate incoming vendor-based data and use data mining and cleansing techniques tocreate and/or update item master data and item attributesCommunicate with both internal and external stakeholders regarding project status andany risks to timelinesSupport Offshore Resource team through clarification of standards, creating workpackages, managing workload, quality review, publishing and dashboarding of KPIsContinuous review and tracking of KPIs for incoming dataLeveraging data to identify, implement and document opportunities for more efficientwork processes or enhancements to existing processes/systemsComparison of Vendor and Hospital data to improve data integrity and data availabilityUtilize various data analytic tools and techniques to identify issues such as duplicateitems or inconsistency in attributesSupport system enhancements: Providing test cases, completing test cases, creatingtraining documents and training peers
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSPost-Secondary Education in Business, Accounting, or Health Informatics education would be an asset, 2+ years’ experience, in data mining, cleansing and manipulation related field. Problem solving, research skills and customer service.Expert analytical skills: conceptual thinker with advanced problem solving and decision-making skills, highly motivated and resourceful to perform with limited supervisionData Oriented Personality: enjoys making sense of data, exploring data, looking forpatterns and inconsistencies and massaging data to present a story in a clear andconcise mannerSelf-Motivated and organized; able to work under pressure, lead others and managemultiple tasks and deadlinesTeam Player with ability to take personal ownership for deliverables and timelinesStrong presentation skills in both creation and delivery
TRAVELAbility to travel to Mohawk Medbuy offices in Burlington, London and Brantford.As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccinationto Human Resources.Mohawk Medbuy is committed to providing accessible employment practices that complywith the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).
companyDescription: We’re a national, not-for-profit, shared services organization entrusted by hundreds of Canadian hospitals and health care providers to drive value, efficiencies and cost-savings on the supplies and services they use.

jobDescription:
We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about food and enjoys working in a fast paced, customer service centric, team environment!
Longo’s is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where team members have a place to grow and pursue excellence, have the latitude to take ownership of their careers and the support and encouragement necessary to be the best they can throughout their career. We are a Canadian, family operated food retailer which has grown and prospered since 1956. Our team members are dedicated to exceeding customer expectations by offering the best food experience to every customer, every time. It is through such commitment that Longo’s now operates over 36 stores within the GTA along with Grocery Gateway; our online grocery delivery service, is celebrating 65 years of business and is continuing to grow!
Do you have experience implementing SQL-Based BI Solutions (SSRS, SSIS)?
Have you developed code using C#, .NET, JSON/RESTAPI?
Have you worked in MicroStrategy or any other similar tool ?
Why not join us? Position: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst 
The Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for perform leading the ETL transformations from source application systems to Longo’s BI Environment including data validations and ensuring accuracy of reports. The individual will work in collaborative manner across all the departments leveraging the data gathered in data-warehouse. The individual will work hands-on with different programming languages to achieve the desired result. The incumbent will be involved in all aspects of the reporting and intelligence life cycle from requirements gathering, report design and delivery, documentation, end user support and report administration. The individual will be assisting the developments of current integrations and working with team on onshore/offshore developers to ensure the delivery of the product. Working as part of a team to support the existing infrastructure and to ensure that reporting and intelligence requirements are met in a timely manner and that maximum business impact is achieved.
Accountabilities:Analysis:Develop systems and support environment for analysing data to help drive and support business decisions.Generate ETLs and integrations for transforming data from source systems to destination warehouse.Create standard or ad hoc reports to enable business analysis, applying business acumen to Identify trends, opportunities and Financial impacts, linking multiple data sources together to drive towards a conclusion.Manage overall database to ensure all information is accurate and up to date across channels.Create validation reports/alerts/notifications for the integrations running between systems.Work with the BI team to create, target and measure communications plans providing commentary and recommendationsAnalyses offer and segmentation strategy to identify growth opportunities.Develop reporting and analytic tools to empower users to access resultsEnsure Project Management methodologies are followed in detail for assigned projects (Scoping, planning and implementation)
Customer Service Support:Consistently demonstrates Genuine Merchant Customer Service when supporting our Loyalty application software and other enterprise software by:Acting as an information resource by sharing expertise and knowledge for projects and software enhancementsCollaborating with end-users, developers and analysts to identify and resolve issues in a timely mannerProvide support to business to manage data integrity, such as exceptional reportsProvide on-call and on-site support and problem resolution for reporting and application issues
Documentation & Maintenance:Document all development and customizations, including report specifications, and diagramsMaintain the IT knowledge database with BI development documentation
What we are looking for:University Degree/Diploma in Computer Science or other technically related subject or equivalent experience3-5 years’ experience in Business Intelligence & Data Analysis including working with business users, reporting, analysis, and/or data mining to effectively leverage the MS Business Intelligence tech stack3-5 years’ experience of implementing BI solutions in SQL 2008/2012 database, ETL, SSRS, and SSIS3-5 years’ experience of designing, implementing, and administering solutions in MicroStrategy3-5 years experience in scripting and programming foundations using MS Visual Studio, C#.NET, JSON/RESTAPIExperience in retail, food, warehousing or transportation sectors preferredERP/CRM, Order Management, Warehouse Management Systems & MicroStrategy preferredFamiliar with Oracle database, able to write PL-SQL queries, views, and proceduresProficiency in database access methods and utilitiesIn-depth understanding of BI concepts of Data Warehousing, Data Marts, ETL processes and multidimensional cubesProven ability and experience in applying strong business case analysis to new/existing initiatives and/or large project opportunities; data-driven approachAbility to understand project requirements, multi-task and manage time efficiently while working under pressure in a dynamic fast paced technical environmentStrong verbal and written communication skills including creating technical documents and communicating with non-technical individualsTeam orientated with the ability to work collaboratively
Working Conditions:Work is performed in an office environment with participation in meetings.Ability to manage multiple projects and changing priorities with regular deadlinesTravel to stores and warehouse locations if required.
Longo’s is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.
Note: A qualified job applicant with a disability is one who possesses the required skills, education, experience and training and who can, with reasonable accommodation, perform the essential functions of the position applied for.
If you require accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Coordinator at:Email: hrdept@longos.com

jobDescription:
Acuren is a trusted, single source provider of technology-enabled asset protection solutions used to evaluate the structural integrity of critical energy, industrial and public infrastructures. Committed to delivering a Higher Level of Reliability, Acuren provides an unrivaled spectrum of capabilities including inspection, traditional and advanced NDE/NDT, failure analysis, rope access, materials engineering, reliability engineering and condition based monitoring services.

Our work is critical to the integrity and safety of industrial firms, including petroleum refinery, pipeline, power generation, pulp & paper, mining, pharmaceutical, aerospace and automotive industries. Acuren employs over 4,500 dedicated professionals supporting the mechanical integrity and inspection programs of the world’s largest industrial segments.

Acuren is a market leader. Our formula for success is straightforward: be capable locally, with certified and well-equipped personnel supported by trained, experienced leaders. Continuing to build on a strong heritage of safety, quality and professionalism, Acuren strives to maintain incident free work environments, pursues advanced technical developments, and supports reliability programs that are valued by clients and employees. Acuren is a part of Rockwood Service Corporation, together with Hellier and Tacten.

Position Information 
Rotational scheduled: 7/7 rotationFIFO from Alberta Hubs
Position Requirements
Experience with Visions Software and and NDE backgroundEIT or P.Eng. considered an assetCWB 2 considered an assetAPI 570 considered an assetStrong work ethicsAbility to maintain positive working relations with clientsExceptional safety and quality awareness Ability to solve problems and manage time effectivelySelf-motivated and capable of working at a high technical and performance levelValid driver's licenseIRATA training or willingness to obtain is an asset
We Support an Equal Opportunity Workplace

Consideration for employment is based upon capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada; work permits may be applied for in the case of appropriately qualified applicants.

Other

Prospective employees must be able to perform all tasks as detailed on the complete Physical Job Description, be Fit for Duty at all times and be able to comply with the Canadian Model for Providing a Safe Workplace which includes alcohol and drug testing.

The strength of Acuren lies in its’ outstanding people. As a rapidly growing, intensely innovative, international privately held company, the opportunities to pursue challenging and diverse career development paths are vast. Complemented by an attractive and comprehensive total compensation package and a commitment to the principles of a respectful workplace, Acuren offers tremendous opportunities to those who wish to succeed.

Next steps

If you are interested in this employment opportunity, please apply in confidence through Acuren's online application process with copies of your certifications at www.acuren.com.

We appreciate your interest in a career at Acuren, however only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further information. Agency services are not required at this time
companyDescription:
Since its inception in 1974, Acuren has been a trusted, single source provider of technology-enabled asset protection solutions used to evaluate the structural integrity of critical energy, industrial and public infrastructures. 

Committed to delivering a Higher Level of Reliability, Acuren provides an unrivaled spectrum of capabilities, including inspection, traditional and advanced NDE/NDT, failure analysis, rope access, materials engineering, reliability engineering and condition based monitoring services. 

Our work is critical to the integrity and safety of industrial firms, including petroleum refinery, pipeline, power generation, wind, pulp & paper, pharmaceutical, aerospace and automotive industries. Acuren employs more than 4,000 dedicated professionals, dispatched from more than 90 locations across the continent, supporting the mechanical integrity and inspection programs of the world’s largest industrial segments. 

We are the only N285 certified NDT company in Canada which allows us to perform nuclear scopes of work directly as an EPC rather than subcontracting to another EPC firm.

Acuren is a market leader. Our formula for success is straightforward: be capable locally, with certified and well-equipped personnel supported by trained, experienced leaders. Local competence is further supported by a corporate commitment to exceptional service, with subject-matter experts, management systems, and best-available technology to assure that the efforts provided locally also represent best practices globally. Continuing to build on a strong heritage of safety, quality and professionalism, Acuren strives to maintain incident free work environments, pursues advanced technical developments, and supports reliability programs that are valued by clients and employees.

We strive to demonstrate that we have an opportunity to earn our customer’s business every day and that we understand the need to deliver more value in the future.

jobDescription:
The Data Warehouse Services team plays a vital role in our organization. They are responsible for storing vast quantities of data from many sources and responsible for disseminating data across the organizations to various different groups. They are one of the backbones of data at our organization and they are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join their team.

What You'll Be Doing
Work with internal constituents, including; Directors, Analysts, and Developers to understand business requirements/goals, and help capture the strategy, content, and features for layout of our reporting environments.Working with business partners at all levels to discuss data analysis/requirementsAnalyze data and structure from data martsWork effectively in a fast-paced environment, where multi-tasking may be necessaryParticipate in brainstorming sessions regarding functional requirements, content organization, process flow, and report specifications.Develop queries for investigation of data issues or creation of new report structures for business units.Partner with Database administrators and developers to establish high-level time and effort estimates based on client requirements during report project kickoffs, and then refining the estimate during each iteration.Collaborate with Project Managers to identify project status, potential risks and issues.Become a subject area expertAssist in the coordination of development road-maps
Must Haves

What you'll need to be successful:
Use knowledge of tools to create extract analysis from SQL server/excel/powerbi/cubes Strong customer support experience is a must (dealing with internal clients)This is a senior position so we require strong technical skills:TSQL / SQL / MysqlExcelPowerBI Understanding Data flow ConceptsUnderstanding Business Model Concepts 
As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees

In this role you may be exposed to adult content

MindGeek continues to drive the state of technology forward, developing industry-leading solutions enabling faster, more efficient delivery of content every second to millions of customers worldwide. The Company is committed to enhancing its technological capabilities and thrives on a sustainable growth trajectory built on innovation and excellence.

With over 1400 employees worldwide, MindGeek continues its expansion with the acquisition and licensing of some of the most iconic brands in entertainment media.

jobDescription:
The future you want is within reach.

At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry.

We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of. Whether you are looking for a corporate or construction career, exciting opportunities are waiting for you. Our people have helped us stand out as a leading general contracting organization, which is why we’re always looking for new talent—individuals who can bring innovative solutions and thinking to every project.

We are seeking an experienced Procurement Data Analyst for our North American Headquarters office located in Edmonton, AB. This position will support and further develop the supply chain program related to PCL’s national supply agreements and procurement processes to support district purchasing teams. They will support the development, implementation and continuous improvement of systems and processes intended to manage supply risk and capitalize on opportunities. The Procurement Data Analyst will report to the Manager, Procurement and Equipment

Here's how a Procurement Data Analyst for our Edmonton NAHQ office contributes to our team:

Responsibilities
Utilizes computer models, process analysis, and business analytics to interpret data to make business decisions and efficiently answer complicated business problemsLeads and supports business process improvement initiatives, including the implementation and development of processes and applications to support district procurement initiativesAssists in the development and continuous improvement of procurement systems, including system documentation and roll-outIdentifies and respond to customer needs and challenges by developing customer focused solutionsGathers, validates and documents business requirementsCoordinates solution walk-throughs and sign-offs, verifying with stakeholders that requirements have been metSupports and participates in district and corporate cross-functional project teams Subscribes to the departments culture of project ownership and continuous improvementDocuments and maintains streamlined business practices in the form of business guides, work instruction and business processes documentsExecutes change management plans to drive acceptance, adoption, minimize resistance, and maximize engagement and efficienciesAssists with training and roll-outs as requiredSupports the group with any required procurement needs as required Coordinates centralized, large volume purchases on behalf of our operating districts in accordance with policies and procedures.

Qualifications
Minimum of three years of experience in business analysis and/or three years experience in procurement, preferably in the construction industry. Postsecondary degree or diploma in Management Information Systems, Supply Chain Management, Bachelor of Commerce majoring in Operations Management or equivalent Construction knowledge and/or experience is considered an assetProficient in Microsoft OfficeExperience creating reporting using Power BI or other data visualization software,Excellent time management skills and can prioritize and communicate to ensure deadlines are metComfortable working independently with aggressive project schedulesComfortable working in a high accountability cultureStrong interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsA positive attitude with a passion and commitment to both a project and a teams successAble to develop creative solutions to meet customer needs for company-wide processes and softwareAbility to work effectively within a team environment, is flexible, has strong listening skills and communicates well.Develop and maintain strong working relationships with district procurement teams and other corporate departments. 

PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.

The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating equitable opportunities and an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants. We make employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.

PCL combines numerous pay and benefit strategies to provide a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package. Any salary range displayed by a job board is an estimate. Your salary, which considers your unique qualifications and experience, is just one component of the robust total rewards you'll enjoy at PCL. This may include an employee share purchase offering, discretionary annual performance bonus, comprehensive benefits and wellness programs, retirement plan plus matching, and career development programs.

Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please contact us at careers@pcl.com with the position and location you are interested in.

Together, we can build success and a better future. Let’s get started!

Employee Status: Regular Full-Time

Company: PCL Constructors Inc.

Primary Location: Edmonton, Alberta (Corporate)

Job: Procurement Data Analyst

Requisition: 2505
companyDescription:
PCL is a group of independent construction companies that carries out work across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean, and in Australia. These diverse operations in the civil infrastructure, heavy industrial, and buildings markets are supported by a strategic presence in 31 major centers.

PCL is 100% employee-owned. Watch us build at www.pcl.com

jobDescription:
Aidez-nous à façonner audacieusement le commerce de détail au Canada.
La riche tradition de la Société Canadian Tire de servir les Canadiens d’un océan à l’autre remonte à 1922. Notre vision est de devenir la première marque de détail au Canada et nous mettons l’accent sur l’innovation et les investissements importants dans notre Société, surtout lorsqu’il s’agit de nos employés. Pour atteindre notre objectif, nous avons besoin des meilleurs talents pour nous aider à évoluer et à susciter le changement dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise – et à faire partie des pionniers du secteur de la vente au détail au Canada. Alors que nous nous efforçons d’être à l’avant-garde d’un secteur de la vente au détail complexe et en pleine évolution, le moment est propice pour se joindre à la famille d’entreprises Canadian Tire, car elle connaît une période particulièrement exaltante.
En vous joignant à l’équipe de Canadian Tire, dans la division de FGL Sports, vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe d’analystes en gestion des datas. Votre rôle à titre d’analyste des données sera d’appuyer l’architecture des datas dans le développement des différents besoins en requêtes auprès de multiples sources de base de données de l’entreprise. Vous devrez concevoir, réaliser et gérer la structure des systèmes de rapports. L’analyste de données est responsable des initiatives d’extractions de données de nos différents systèmes, de la validation auprès des départements de l’entreprise quant aux demandes ponctuelles et aux développements de projets.
Vos principales fonctions
Appuyer les différentes demandes provenant de l’entreprise en étant responsable de l’optimisation et de la création de requêtes SQL.Concevoir, réaliser, livrer et gérer des modèles et des rapports à l’aide d’Excel et Power BIPrésentation des données à partir de multiples sources de base de données de l’entreprise.Participer à l’architecture des données et la conception de la solution des données de nos différents systèmes.Collaborer avec les analystes dans l’élaboration des connexions et des extractions avec nos différentes bases de données (« DataLake », Dynamics AX ou Dynamics 365, Azure, I Hub ingestion).Soutenir les validations des données lors de l’intégration des systèmes sous différentes plateformesAnalyser les impacts dans les systèmes déjà existants lors des demandes de changements ; Analyser et collaborer les spécifications structurelles pour les nouveaux logiciels et les nouvelles applicationsDévelopper une compréhension approfondie des différents processusPrendre en charge la documentation des processus et fournir des recommandations d’automatisationParticiper aux ateliers de travail afin de recueillir les exigences et de formuler des recommandations concernant les solutions de rapports et de BIConvertir les processus en exigences fonctionnelles d’une manière claire et compréhensible pour les développeurs et les équipes de projet;Tirer profit de la connaissance des produits de données spécifiques disponibles ainsi que les capacités de visualisation pour améliorer les exigences et offrir des suggestions pertinentes aux parties prenantes.Hiérarchiser les tâches avec l’équipe et s’assurer de la disponibilité de feuilles de route prospectives pour les fonctionnalités devant être fournies sur les produits de données relevant de l’équipe.Collaborer avec les analystes d’Intelligence d’affaires et le département IT dans la réalisation des différents besoins, ainsi qu’aux activités de maintenance et d’évolution.
Vos Qualifications Et Compétences
Baccalauréat en discipline quantitative (mathématiques, statistiques, informatique, économique)Expérience de plus de 3 ans en analyse des données et bonne compréhension de l’architecture des données.Connaissance pratique des concepts et de la terminologie d’IA et de l’entrepôt de données;Excellentes compétences en Excel, notamment avec l’utilisation de formules et de macros avancées;Connaissance approfondie de SQL, ETL, Power BI (conception de rapports & visualisation) et Microsoft Azure.Expérience en Microsoft Dynamics AX ou Dynamics 365(atout) ou connaissance en Thoughtspot (atout)Expérience en analyse, modélisation, vérification et développement de méthodologies d’exigences commerciales et techniques;Capacité à établir, à documenter et à communiquer les normes, politiques, directives et structures de gouvernance en matière de modélisation de données. Capacité de hiérarchiser les projets en respectant les échéanciers.Motivé et capable de travailler de manière autonomeExcellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite avec la capacité de faire le lien et de décrire les situations à l’aide de données; Capacité à expliquer des phénomènes complexes de façon claire et concise à tout type d’audience ;Personne minutieuse et passionnée par la qualité et les nouvelles technologies.Excellente maîtrise du français et de l'anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit
Canadian Tire et sa famille d’entreprises façonnent audacieusement le commerce de détail au Canada et nous continuons d’offrir une expérience positive à nos clients. Étant l’une des marques les plus fiables au Canada, nos employés sont fiers du travail que nous accomplissons partout au pays. Ce n’est pas que le triangle emblématique qui nous permet de garder nos employés. Les avantages sociaux, les occasions d’apprentissage et de perfectionnement et notre engagement envers Bon départ sont quelques-unes des nombreuses raisons pour lesquelles la Société Canadian Tire est l’une des sociétés les mieux gérées au Canada.
Pour en savoir plus sur cette équipe et la famille d’entreprises Canadian Tire, suivez-nous sur LinkedIn.
Canadian Tire souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Nous nous engageons à offrir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif pour tous. Nous sommes conscients que notre succès futur dépend du point de vue et des contributions de tous nos employés – leurs antécédents, leurs compétences et leurs expériences d’une grande diversité renforcent notre Société. Si l’on communique avec vous pour une possibilité d’emploi, veuillez nous indiquer tout ajustement nécessaire pour nous assurer que vous ayez accès à un processus de recrutement et de sélection juste et équitable. Les renseignements fournis seront traités de manière confidentielle et utilisés uniquement dans le but d’offrir une expérience accessible à nos candidats.

jobTitle: Specialist, T&S Project and Performance Support (Business Analytics)
jobDescription:
Permanent - Full Time
At SaskPower, we generate more than just electricity for Saskatchewan people. We offer some of the best jobs in the province.
Our challenging careers will help you grow while being surrounded by a fully-committed team, committed to safety, openness, collaboration and accountability. If you’re someone who thrives in a team environment and doesn’t shy away from a good challenge, join us!Apply no later than 12/07/2022 to be considered for this opportunity. JOB SUMMARY:The Specialist is accountable to provide subject matter expertise and administration of data analytics with SaskPower’s Technology and Security area. As a member of SaskPower’s management team, this position is responsible to act as a central point of contact in the management and administration of strategic and operational functions, providing expert advice and direction that aligns with departmental and corporate goals and objectives.This role is responsible for data analysis in support of measuring business performance. The role will develop metrics, KPIs and dashboards in support of SaskPower’s goals and objectives and in response to critical business questions. Where necessary the individual will add structure to the data, identify new required data points, and recommend realistic data collection methods. They will utilize the data to report, visualize, and ultimately tell the story of performance to various audiences and more importantly highlight recommended actions for improvement. The individual must effectively collaborate with stakeholders across SaskPower to deliver meaningful results.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:· Collect data from a variety of sources using existing methods and, where required, define new and sustainable collection techniques.· Define and manage metadata.· Create mechanisms for exploring structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data to identify patterns.· Assess data quality and support ongoing data integrity.· Generate insights and, where appropriate, recommendations from the available information.· Create reports in Microsoft Power BI (or similar if SaskPower toolset changes) and, where required, present insights and recommendations to leadership and stakeholders.· Commission and decommission datasets.· Handle confidential information responsibly and in accordance with applicable policy and procedures.· Train and transition ongoing reporting to appropriate team members.· Plan, research, develop, evaluate, and implement processes, policies and procedures utilized for the development of strategies and business initiatives that address the organization’s requirements· Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics to develop, implement, coach, and assist management staff in the administration and interpretation of corporate policies; providing advice that is appropriate, practical, and consistent with relevant legislation, regulations, laws and/or industry standards· Identify new business solutions and operational efficiencies, while providing recommendations which have a significant impact on SaskPower’s business operations and strategies· Lead and/or participate in cross-functional projects to provide data expertise for corporate and departmental strategic planning initiatives· Maintain knowledge of industry developments and best practices related to data analytics and adapt them to SaskPower’s operational environment· Provide leadership and direction to project teams and/or assigned staff as required
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES: • Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or other related equivalent AND/OR; • Related professional designation(s) and/or certification(s) AND/OR; • Five (5) years of related business analytics experience • Team player with the ability to build and maintain strategic relationships both internal and external to SaskPower • Results oriented thinker, with the ability to manage and provide advice regarding complex and confidential issues with sensitivity and professionalism • Excellent analytical, research and problem solving skills • Excellent oral and written communication skills • Ability to work and manage in a changing environment • Excellent facilitation, project management and decision making skills • Ability to foster a culture focused on safety, innovation and teamwork • Demonstrated skill in SaskPower’s competencies • Must have a continuing record of professional development 
A suitable combination of relevant education and experience may also be consideredCandidates under consideration may be required to participate in an assessment process consisting of any/all of the following: interview, abilities test, case study and/or presentation.SaskPower has identified competencies that enable performance and success within each out of scope role at SaskPower. For more information on these job family competencies and those that relate to the position that you are applying on, please visit: https://www.saskpower.com/Careers/Join-Our-Team/competencies
SaskPower offers a competitive salary and benefits package. Diversity and inclusion are also a priority for us. At SaskPower, we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and having a workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are committed to selections based on merit and to the full participation of diversity groups. These groups include the four equity groups recognized by the Saskatchewan Human Rights Commission: Indigenous Peoples, Members of Visible Minority Groups / Racialized Groups, Persons with Disabilities and Women in Under-Represented Roles, as well as LGBTQ persons and Newcomers to Saskatchewan. Visit our website for details.
To learn more about SaskPower, check us out on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/PoweringthefutureKeep posted on the latest job openings on Twitter: www.twitter.com/saskpowerPlease apply by 12/07/2022.
companyDescription:
Since 1929, we've delivered power throughout our province. Today, we strive to serve an increasingly diverse and sophisticated customer base of over 540,000 customers. Our team of dedicated employees is made up of over 3,200 permanent full-time employees.
 
Our power assets:
 
We manage over $12 billion in total assets. Our company operates:

• three coal-fired power stations
• seven hydroelectric stations
• seven natural gas stations
• two wind facilities
 
Our power suppliers:
 
We also purchase power from the following producers:

• Red Lily Wind Energy Facility
• SunBridge Wind Energy Facility
• Western Lily Wind Energy Facility
• Morse Wind Energy Facility
• NRGreen Kerrobert, Loreburn, Estlin and Alameda Heat Recovery Facilities
• Spy Hill Generating Station
• North Battleford Generating Station
 
Our total available generation capacity is 4,993 MW
 
Our power network:

Our network serves a large geographic area and widely-dispersed population. We maintain more than 157,000 kilometres of power lines, 56 high voltage switching stations and 197 distribution substations. Our company also has interconnections at the Manitoba, Alberta and North Dakota borders.
 
*Information as of March 31, 2020

jobTitle: Senior Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
 In this Role, you’ll get  to: 
Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful testsDisplay: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and othersModeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers
