jobTitle: Analyste, conversion de données SAP et gouvernance
jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

Résumé des fonctions

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP participe à la feuille de route de l’écosystème SAP en planifiant et en exécutant des activités liées aux données et en offrant son expertise à cet effet. Cette personne joue un rôle primordial puisque le CN entreprend actuellement un vaste programme de transformation pluriannuel de ses activités, déclenché par une migration des produits SAP ECC vers SAP S/4 HANA.

La personne titulaire du poste travaille au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire et participe à une variété d’activités en lien avec les données : profilage, évaluation de la qualité et nettoyage d’objets de données de base et transactionnelles, dont l’élaboration et la mise en œuvre de stratégies de nettoyage de données; le mappage, la transformation et l’enrichissement de données de base pour prendre en compte les nouveaux modèles de données et les exigences de transformation des produits SAP; et les tâches de gouvernance et de gestion des données selon l’approbation des flux de travail, des configurations et des processus pour assurer la conformité des objets de données aux normes de qualité du CN tout au long de leur cycle de vie.

Cette personne participe aux parcours de validation des données, au dépannage, à la réconciliation des données et à la détermination de mesures correctives avant les migrations vers la version de production.

La personne en poste favorise le développement des compétences et de l’expérience en matière d’établissement et de pratiques de gestion de données de premier ordre, qui deviennent une composante essentielle des secteurs qui adoptent des approches de transformation numérique axées sur les données.

Principales responsabilités

Profilage et nettoyage des données – Tâches liées aux données dans l’environnement actuel – 30 %

Participer à la détermination des objets de données et au profilage des règles commerciales

Évaluer la qualité des données et consigner les indicateurs de mesure de qualité

Participer à la mise en œuvre de stratégies de nettoyage manuel et automatisé des objets de données

Collaborer à la validation itérative post-nettoyage et à la mise en œuvre des mesures correctives

Tirer parti des outils spécialisés et prêts à utiliser pour effectuer des tâches

Mappage et transformation des données – Tâches liées aux données dans l’environnement souhaité – 40 %

Participer à la détermination et à la conception des activités et de la documentation liées au mappage, à la transformation et à l’enrichissement des données fonctionnelles, conformément aux efforts de réingénierie des processus d’affaires et des nouvelles structures de données S/4 HANA

Mettre en œuvre des solutions de type bac à sable pour évaluer les méthodes de transformation et de mappage des données, y compris les algorithmes

Effectuer des parcours de validation itératifs et mettre en place des mesures correctives aux conversions

Tirer parti des outils spécialisés et prêts à utiliser ainsi que des plateformes de conversion pour effectuer des tâches

Gouvernance et gestion des données – Tâches liées aux données associées aux cycles de vie et aux améliorations des données – 30 %

Déterminer, mettre en œuvre et valider les exigences des flux de travail de la gouvernance et des règles des données d’affaires pour la gestion des données de base, en collaboration avec les responsables

Participer à l’évaluation de la qualité des données des systèmes cibles

Appliquer une feuille de route et une stratégie de gouvernance des données sur des outils et des plateformes spécialisés de gestion des données

Participer aux conceptions et à la documentation fonctionnelles, à la configuration de systèmes et à la validation

Schématiser les exigences de gouvernance des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise dans l’environnement SAP

Conditions de travail

Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. En raison de la nature du poste, le ou la titulaire doit être en mesure de respecter des échéanciers serrés, de bien tolérer la pression et de gérer le stress.

Exigences

Expérience

Gestion et traitement des données d’entreprise

De 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en gestion et en traitement des données d’entreprise

Formation, certification et désignation

Baccalauréat dans un domaine technique ou commercial avec un intérêt pour la gestion des données

Baccalauréat en analyse commerciale, en mathématiques, en statistiques, en science des données ou en génie*
 Toute désignation dans l’un des domaines ci-dessus constitue un atout
Compétences

Inspirer les autres par des communications efficaces et s’adapter à l’auditoire à l’oral et à l’écrit

Utiliser le raisonnement analytique

Faire preuve d’innovation par la résolution de problèmes

Connaître l’entreprise et être à l’affût des tendances du secteur pour développer son expertise et mieux accomplir son travail

Faire preuve d’un bon sens de l’organisation

Collaborer avec les principaux intervenants internes pour fournir un meilleur rendement

Être en mesure de travailler de manière autonome sans supervision

Connaissances et compétences techniques

Vif intérêt pour la gestion et la validation des données, notamment ses attributs et caractéristiques ainsi que sa valeur pour l’entreprise

Expérience pratique en planification et en exécution générale de tâches d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement (ETL) de données*

Expérience avec des systèmes de planification des ressources d’entreprise (PRE), en particulier SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Intérêt pour les processus d’affaires et la façon dont les données sont interreliées avec ces processus

Intérêt pour l’exploration des données, la réalisation d’enquêtes et d’analyses et l’application de la résolution et de la validation dans des ensembles de données complexes

Connaissance d’Excel ou d’autres outils de productivité

Capacité et intérêt dans le développement de connaissances avancées d’utilisation de plateformes et d’outils de gestion des données spécialisés comme Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia et SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Capacité de présenter et de communiquer clairement les résultats

Connaissance du langage SQL (Structured Query Language) et des scripts, notamment SQL Server Management Studio*
 Toute connaissance dans l’un des domaines ci-dessus constitue un atout
Incidence sur l’entreprise

Prise de décisions et incidence des décisions

La personne titulaire du poste effectue des tâches axées sur les données qui sont essentielles à la feuille de route et au cycle de vie de l’écosystème SAP.

Degré d’interaction ou d’influence

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP interagit avec les experts en données des clients internes et de l’I et T, des coordonnateurs, des spécialistes de la technologie des données, des architectes de solutions et des équipes de gouvernance des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise. En outre, cette personne collabore étroitement avec leurs homologues commerciaux et fonctionnels des Finances, de l’Approvisionnement, de la Gestion de l’approvisionnement, de la Mécanique et de l’Ingénierie.

Supervision du personnel/structure organisationnelle

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP relève du directeur principal ou de la directrice principale Transformation SAP S/4HANA, Gouvernance et migration des données – Information et technologie. Ce poste ne comporte aucune responsabilité de supervision.

À propos du CN

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.

jobTitle: Senior Data Analyst, Partner Development – (Statistics/ML/BI) (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
Get to know our team:
Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.
In this role you’ll get to
This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market.
Key activities involved include but not limit to:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendationsOwn end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner DevelopmentBuild dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvementsWork closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identifiedSupport global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline4-8 years experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy roleExcellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using dataTeam player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skillsCoding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choiceAbility to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environmentExcellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobDescription:
Vous avez le souci de bien servir vos clients, êtes reconnu pour votre capacité à résoudre des problèmes et avez une facilité à synthétiser et à vulgariser l’information?

Votre rôle sera central dans l’équipe à l’équipe de Soutien aux Affaires et vous contribuerez à appuyer les objectifs de croissance du secteur de l’individuel par vos analyses et vos recommandations basées sur la connaissance fine de nos clients.
Responsabilités :
Le rôle de l’analyste intelligence d'affaires est de faire les premières analyses sur les données.Procéder à l’examen et à l’analyse de données provenant de multiples sources internes et externesInterpréter les besoins pour les transformer en solutions avec PowerBIFaire parler des données à travers des rapports pertinents répondant aux besoinsÊtre en mode solution pour améliorer l’expérience clientCollaborer avec l’équipe pour amener la meilleure solutionMettre en place de nouvelles données transformées pour faciliter leur production et leur exploitationAnalyser les besoins clients et à les documenter
Profil recherché :
Baccalauréat en intelligence d’affaires, statistiques, mathématiques, actuariat, informatique, administration ou autre discipline connexeTrois ans d’expérience pertinente en intelligence d’affaires ou information de gestionConnaissance en Power BIConnaissance du langage SQLConnaissance des techniques d’analyse statistique et de modélisation, un atoutPolyvalence dans les tâches à effectuerÊtre en mesure de travailler sur plusieurs tâches et projets en même tempsMotivation pour la performance et l’atteinte des résultatsCapacité à comprendre, analyser, synthétiser, émettre des diagnostics et recommanderCapacité à travailler sous pression et respecter les échéanciersÊtre proactif et innovateur dans la recherche de solutionsFacilité à communiquer et vulgariser des concepts complexesExcellentes aptitudes linguistiques en français et en anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit en raison des interactions fréquentes avec des collègues ou partenaires internes et externes anglophones et francophones à travers le Canada.

jobDescription:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leader’s partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Ensure comprehensive test coverage by creating well-structured test plans and test casesDesign and develop manual & automation scriptsResponsible for finding, isolating, documenting, tracking, and regressing defects through the QE process utilizing a bug tracking tool effectivelyWork with testing data: seeding, masking, synthetic data generationWork with Big data platform to validate data ingestion, ETL, data integrity, data analytical reports etc.Analyze ongoing requirements to ensure quality delivery, aligned with business goals and enterprise and Technology Solutions (TS) standards.Work collaboratively with stakeholders across business and technology teams seeking opportunities to improve the quality of delivery and demonstrate commitment to operational excellence for all deliverables.Estimate testing effort working with other team members and set priorities following a risk-based testing approachCreate and run queries using Hue to meet business needsCreate and review test cases; Report test results and highlight any potential quality risksTo accelerate product delivery through test automation.Assess risk with projects delivery quality, identify and execute risk mitigation plans
What do you bring to the role?
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.5+ years experience in Quality engineeringProven experience within the Insurance Industry2+ years experience in the technical area of specialty, specifically SQL and Big Data Stack (Hue, Hive, Impala, HBase), BigQuery, Cloud, Python/Pyspark or similar data platformStrong ability to analyze the business and user requirements and translate them into testing deliverables such as testing data, SQL query and expected resultsStrong ability to develop test plans and run analysis on testing resultsExperience in data ingestion, ETL testing, data integrity testing and Data lake/Cloud testingExperience in any DH Automation tools or technologies (Python/Pyspark)Experience in Agile software development practice and methodologiesGoal-oriented; must be able to remove roadblocks and deliver goalsStrong communication and interpersonal skillsProven ability to quickly and easily adapt to change
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).
companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Get to know our family of companies:
Economical Insurance
Sonnet Insurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline Insurance
-
Definity investit dans des activités multicanaux afin d’offrir à nos concitoyens canadiens des options de couverture optimales pour leurs domiciles, véhicules, fermes, animaux de compagnie et entreprises.

Nous sommes fiers d’être Canadiens et nous offrons une gamme de solutions d’assurance adaptées ainsi qu’un service à nos clients d’un bout à l’autre du pays. Definity a des racines profondes, qui remontent au 25 novembre 1871, lorsque notre marque fondatrice, l’Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, a émis sa première police pour protéger l’étable et la maison d’Ismael D. Bowman. Aujourd’hui, Definity poursuit sa tradition d’offrir aux Canadiens un excellent service, tant par l’entremise d’un courtier d’assurance autorisé que par notre réseau numérique direct.

Découvrez notre famille de compagnies :
Assurance Economical
Sonnet Assurance
Family Insurance Solutions
Petline

jobDescription:
Vendor Manager On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Vendor Manager Vendor Manager - Job Description
Provide data, analytics, insights, opportunities for improvements and assist to manage the vendor inventory report and work with Business Intelligence team to transform the vendor inventory report to Tableau Work with AVP, Vendor Management to develop and execute on vendor portfolio strategies for new vendors (as a result of an acquisition or rationalization) Develops and maintains effective relationships with internal partners and vendor(s) to ensure business priorities requirements are clearly understood and met, and objectives are aligned Provides advice and guidance to business partners and VM teams as appropriate regarding VM best-practice to optimize and secure value from third-party relationships Understands contractual terms and conditions, and their commercial implications to the business in order to effectively support the vendor managers Engages with SSG sourcing partner to share business, industry and vendor insights in support of strategic planning and contract negotiations May provide input into strategic planning, then implement strategic direction set by Business Leadership across all relevant business units, and lines of business in the case of enterprise vendors, including employment of agreed VM governance Applies organizational change management principles and practices to effectively manage stakeholder and vendor expectations, anticipating downstream impacts and plan accordingly to minimize disruption (e.g., during vendor transition; on-boarding/off-boarding) Engage business partners to ensure active participation on vendor governance and oversight, ensuring roles and responsibilities are clearly defined Applies sound judgment by understanding priorities, dependencies and making pragmatic decisions in the context of enterprise and line of business objectives Develops and retains in-depth knowledge and expertise of marketplace and industry developments pertaining to vendor relationship, category and business requirements  Vendor Manager – Mandatory Skills
Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, customer service and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently and manage one's time Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, data, analytics, business intelligence with regards to vendor management Ability to apply accounting and mathematical principles to work as needed Ability to analyze business trends and project future revenues and expenses Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word and Excel; Enterprise Application experience a plus (including Tririga, Ariba, Coupa, Tableau) Bachelor's degree in business management, economics, finance, accounting or relevant field required 2+ years' experience required  Vendor Manager - Nice to Have Skills
Enterprise Application experience a plus (including Tririga, Ariba, Coupa, Tableau) Experience in large financial organization  Vendor Manager - Assignment Start Date ASAP – 12 months to start Vendor Manager - Assignment Location Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid
companyDescription:
Procom is one of North America’s leading staffing and contract workforce services providers. Successfully meeting the needs of Fortune 500 clients since 1978, we have 11 offices across North America, with over 10,000 skilled professionals currently on assignment.

We are an award winning staffing firm. Discover more about our Best of Staffing award and what real clients and job seekers have to say about working with Procom by checking out our client and talent ratings on ClearlyRated.

Procom has long been recognized as a market-leading source of high-performing services and solutions that transform how our clients acquire and manage the very best talent. Relying on the excellence of individuals to make a difference, we know that people matter. 

And we want to work with you.

jobDescription:
Investment Planning Counsel (IPC) is one of the fastest growing independent wealth management companies in Canada. We are a diverse group of people all driven towards one goal: helping advisors build a better business through a remarkable client experience.
We are proud to be recognized as one of the Greater Toronto Area's Top Employers (2022) by Mediacorp Canada Inc. for empowering our teams with the resources to thrive in a collaborative environment, where wellness is at the forefront.
With your background, skills and experience you’ve already found success in the wealth management industry. Have you found your ideal firm, one that gives you an opportunity to do what you do best every day and provide you with a deep sense of meaning and accomplishment in your career?
Our Culture & Talent team is seeking a Data Insights Specialist – someone to optimize business processes by automating the collection, consolidation, and analysis of data relating to organizational behaviours and trends.

WE WANT YOU TO JOIN OUR TEAM OF WINNERS! 
 What is the role of the Learning Insights Specialist? Review current process for data collection & analysis to provide solutions on process improvement and automationsCollaborate with various business stakeholders to understand the needs of the business and interpretation of the dataDevelop automated data visualization in reports and dashboardsCreate interactive reporting from linked data sourcesAssists in management of financial and non-financial dataDocument procedures and present new process designs to stakeholders for discussion

What traits and competencies should a Learning Insights Specialist possess?Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skillsMacro-perspective – broader and more team-oriented with an eye to impact on the enterpriseExcellent skill of abstraction; ability to decompose a problem and understand the end user needs when designing reports, dashboard and data visualsGenuine interest and passion for working with dataExceptional capability of meeting deadlines and prioritizing workloadStrong attention to relevant specifics

What are the preferred qualifications for a Learning Insights Specialist?Post-secondary educationExperience in Power BI, Visio, SharePoint and the Microsoft Power Platform such as Microsoft Forms and Power Automate an assetReporting software familiarity – as a Business intelligence (BI) professional a general understanding of the underlying theory and application of key reporting software.Strong Excel modelling skills, Microsoft Access, Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Outlook and Adobe ReaderAnalysis skills – statistics, prediction and optimization knowledge are assets

What is #lifeatIPC?Awesome support in providing industry-leading training to help you succeed in your roleAwesome community involvement opportunities through IPC CaresAwesome perks: benefits that fit your needs, pension, share purchase plan, corporate discount plans, social events, summer hours, and funAwesome recognition: kudos, all-star program, rising star, and the circle of excellenceAwesome Leadership teams that know your name

If someone you know sounds like a great fit for this role, send them this job posting and encourage them to apply!

If you continue in the selection process, please notify us of any particular accommodation you might require. Any information you send us will be treated with complete confidence.
companyDescription: Investment Planning Counsel (IPC) is one of Canada's leading independent wealth managers. We are a diverse group of people all driven towards one goal: helping our advisors build a better business. We support over 700 advisors who manage more than $30 billion in investments for over 200,000 Canadians. Our advisors help investors live their dreams through sound financial planning and comprehensive wealth management advice. We have strong family ties to some of Canada’s strongest and most prominent financial firms - IGM Financial and Power Financial Corporation.

jobDescription:
By joining Nortera (formerly known as Bonduelle), you are deciding to make a positive and sustainable impact on yourself, others and the planet.


We strongly believe vegetable food is THE solution to bring well-being through food to the nearly 9 billion inhabitants of our planet while preserving its resources.


The size of our company gives all employees the opportunity to grow, gain autonomy and be in charge of their projects.



WHY CHOOSE NORTERA?Group health insurance programEmployee and family assistance programRetirement savings plan with employer contributionReimbursement program for physical activityTuition reimbursement programAnnual personal tool allowanceAnnual clothing allowanceAnnual safety boots allowanceWellness activitiesReferral programPaid vacation time1 day paid volunteering timeActivities where we serve our communitiesOpportunities for advancement within a growing company!



THE ROLE:As an Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting one of our Major Customers in relation with Sales, Finance and Supply Chain teams. You will be in charge of all system transactions as they relate to our Major Customer production, invoicing, shipments, as well as the inventory reconciliations between two different systems.


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reconcile daily and monthly inventory transactions to ensure accurate and timely invoicing;Utilize ERP system to analyze inventories and update systems;Requires ability to extract and analyze data, and convert information into a usable format for invoicing; Work directly with plants and warehouses as it relates to the customer's transactions; Work directly with Sales and Finance teams regarding actuals, budgets and forecast;Lead Inventory contact on the Customer's contract with Sales rep;Work directly with the Customer regarding work order reconciliation and co-pack volume tracking;Resolve shortages, invoicing, product designation, and open order issues;Work with Plant Quality Managers regarding hold/release process;Lead the yearly physical inventory count requirements; Daily processing and reconciliation of raw material receipt.



PROFILE:Ideally 3 years of experience in Inventory Control or Accounting;Post-secondary education in a related discipline;Outstanding written and verbal communication skills;Ability to gather data from ERP systems;Strong knowledge of inventory flows;Analytical and problem solving skills;Strong computer skills including Excel (formulas, pivot tables);Proven team player, driven and results oriented.


If you recognize yourself, we want to meet you!At Nortera, diversity is a treasure that we cultivate!Join us!

Although all job applications are considered, only successful applicants will be contacted. The masculine credits are used without discrimination and only for the purpose of lightening the text. Nortera is committed to diversity and inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment that highlights the unique contribution of our employees to the success of our business. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage a wide variety of applications so that we can have a diverse workforce that is representative of our customers and the communities where we operate.
companyDescription:
Bonduelle Americas Long Life, leader in the processing of frozen and canned vegetables, is becoming Nortera, whose name evokes the North American regions where we grow and harvest our vegetables. Our company contributes to the well-being of society by offering access to the richness of its land and to a diversity of ready-to-use vegetables. Our head office is located in Brossard and we have processing plants throughout different agricultural regions with their bountiful and fertile lands. Nortera is a vibrant employer who cares about the health and dignity of its workers. We generate hundreds of stimulating jobs throughout Canada and the United States and we believe that offering a pleasant and secure work environment greatly contributes to the development of a healthy and sustainable food supply for North Americans.

Join us!

jobDescription:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English You must be living in the Canada the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in CanadaBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over. ID verification must be attached when submitting your application.
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?Earn extra incomeAccess to our community wellbeing initiativeRemote work & Location IndependenceBe your own bossFlexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyleBe a part of an online community
companyDescription: TELUS International designs, builds and delivers next-generation digital solutions to enhance the customer experience (CX) for global and disruptive brands. The company’s services support the full lifecycle of its clients’ digital transformation journeys and enable them to more quickly embrace next-generation digital technologies to deliver better business outcomes. TELUS International’s integrated solutions and capabilities span digital strategy, innovation, consulting and design, digital transformation and IT lifecycle solutions, data annotation and intelligent automation, and omnichannel CX solutions that include content moderation, trust and safety solutions, and other managed solutions. Fueling all stages of company growth, TELUS International partners with brands across high growth industry verticals, including tech and games, communications and media, eCommerce and fintech, healthcare, and travel and hospitality.

jobDescription:
This role is eligible for our five day flex office work model

Senior Analyst, Flight Pricing Optimization

We’re a data-driven organization, which makes our Analytics and Data Science teams the brains of our operation. On the cutting edge of customer and business analytics, they make sure all our decisions and innovations are based on the latest insights.

Why This Job’s a Big Deal

As an analyst you will influence and challenge pricing decisions made within the Strategic Pricing and Analytics team by delivering insightful analysis, predictive models and innovative ways. The ideal candidate for this role has prior pricing experience inane-commerce or marketplace environment, strong analytical skills with an excellent track-record of execution.

In This Role You Will Get To
The ideal candidate for this role has prior pricing experience in the travel industry, preferably with flights, and strong analytical skills with an excellent track record of executionImplement an improve upon priceline.com's strategy for flight pricing and competitive intelligenceLearn, upgrade and automate various pricing initiatives within priceline.com, partnering with the marketing, finance and other analytical teamsDevelop innovative solutions and techniques to ensure priceline.com's pricing remains competitive, profitable and innovativeInfluence and challenge decisions made by the team through timely &insightful analysis and modelingIdentify appropriate reports to support decision making, recommend and build enhancements to our pricing reporting infrastructurePartner with analytics, sales and marketing teams to optimize our pricing campaigns and streamline our operations
Who You Are
Strong analytical, statistical and problem-solving skills are requiredStrong, hands on SQL experience, preferably with Oracle or BigQuery, but other relational databases are OKExperience building or improving reports using Tableau and/or ExcelExperience with hypothesis testing and A/B testingA ‘can-do’ demeanor and a passion for analytics/dataStrong communication skills, both written and oralTakes ownership for results, “owning” assignments and projectsBachelor of computer science, engineering, statistics and proven experience of 2+years in analytics, consulting or technologyExperience in data science, pricing, travel & e-commerce experience desired
Who We Are

WE ARE PRICELINE.

Our success as one of the biggest players in online travel is all thanks to our incredible, dedicated team of talented employees. Priceliners are focused on being the best travel deal makers in the world, motivated by our passion to help everyone experience the moments that matter most in their lives. Whether it’s a dream vacation, your cousin’s graduation, or your best friend’s wedding - we make travel affordable and accessible to our customers.

Our culture is unique and inspiring (that’s what our employees tell us). We’re a grown-up, startup. We deliver the excitement of a new venture, without the struggles and chaos that can come with a business that hasn’t stabilized.

We’re on the cutting edge of innovative technologies. We keep the customer at the center of all that we do. Our ability to meet their needs relies on the strength of a workforce as diverse as the customers we serve. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.

Priceline is part of the Booking Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: BKNG) family of companies, a highly profitable global online travel company with a market capitalization of over $80 billion. Our sister companies include Booking.com, BookingGo, Agoda, Kayak and OpenTable.

If you want to be part of something truly special, check us out!

Flexible work at Priceline

When we return to the office we will be in a fully flex mode, meaning you decide when to come to the office when it makes sense for you to do so - no minimum number of days in the office. Until then we are all working from home and will return to our flex mode when it is safe to do so.

Diversity and Inclusion are a Big Deal!

To be the best travel dealmakers in the world, it’s important we have a workforce that reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to cultivating a culture where all employees have the freedom to bring their individual perspectives, life experiences, and passion to work.

Priceline is a proud equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate the unique lenses through which our employees see the world. We’d love you to join us and add to our rich mix!

Applying for this position

We're excited that you are interested in a career with us. For all current employees, please use the internal portal to find jobs and apply.

External candidates are required to have an account before applying. When you click Apply, returning candidates can log in, or new candidates can quickly create an account to save/view applications.
companyDescription:
At Priceline, part of Booking Holdings, Inc. [NASDAQ: BKNG], we believe every trip is a big deal to our customers. Whether it’s a much-needed getaway, wedding, reunion, graduation, or rooting on a favorite team—those are the moments that nobody should miss out on.
 
Our mission? Be the best travel dealmakers in the world. We provide our customers with smart and easy ways to access the very best deals available on hotel rooms, flights, rental cars, vacation packages and cruises, so they can be there for the moments that matter the most to them.
 
We do that by welcoming people who are at the top of their game, who want to learn and grow with others and who take their work seriously (but not themselves). We’re building a diverse and uniquely talented team to make sure our customers can be there for all those {big deal} moments. Come join us!

jobDescription:
Company Description

Momentum Financial Services Group, formerly Money Mart Financial Services is a leading provider of financial services in North America. For 40 years we've been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of consumers and business owners. Backed by a retail network of over 450 locations and robust digital and mobile platforms, we provide access to cash and related products to help our customers achieve their goals. We operate retail locations in local communities and cities across Canada under the Money Mart® brand and in Quebec as Insta Cheques® and in United States as Money Mart® and The Check Cashing Store®.

Our highly skilled workforce puts customers first in everything we do. We serve millions of people annually with diverse and innovative financial products and services. Through this ever-evolving suite of services, we empower customers to manage their finances and improve their lives. Wherever customers are on their financial journey, Momentum Financial Services Group provides solutions.

We believe in giving back to the communities where we live and work. With the generous support of our customers and staff, we proudly contribute over two hundred & fifty thousand dollars annually to charities and non-profit organizations, along with using our time and talent to serve in local communities throughout Canada and the United States. We are looking for aspiring, passionate people who are dedicated to understanding and providing our customers with the right financial solutions utilizing a growing menu of products and services. We embrace diversity and offer a fast-paced work environment.

Job Description

GENERAL FUNCTION 

The Collections Analytics team is looking for a business analyst to perform analysis and reporting related to the company’s overdue payment collections efforts and strategies. This person will perform analysis, develop reporting, and identify/recommend collection strategy enhancements.

Duties/Responsibilities
Analyze delinquency and loss trends through ad hoc analyses (using SQL and other relational database tools) and reporting (using reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau and/or Excel)Work with functional partners to deploy tests, collect data, analyze results, and make strategic recommendations related to the company’s collections efforts and programsEstablish and maintain effective collections performance tracking ensuring that strategies are performing as expected and provide recommendations of changes in a timely mannerPresent findings and recommendations to business partners and senior managementAnalyze collections-related factors such as concentrations, product mix, delinquency, loss trending, and process optimizationCreate segmentations to differentiate customer behavior and collectability, as well as optimize treatment, timing, and messageIdentify key risk drivers, analytically segment the customer portfolio along these factors, and assess concentrations, exposures, and exception levelsWork with central modeling teams to build new scorecards and validate existing scoring models as they pertain to use in collection strategiesWork with internal and external partners to develop and evolve digital methods for collections and debt recovery operations.

Qualifications

EDUCATION 

Required: A Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Decision Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or Economics.

Experience
Required: At least 5 years of experience using analytics tools/applications, including SQL. (Additionally, experience with R, Python, and/or Tableau is preferred, but not required.)Required: At least 2 years of experience solving business problems with data/analytics within an analytics-related functional area, such as marketing analytics or credit risk analyticsPreferred (but not required): Experience within collection analytics and/or credit/risk functions of a financial services company.

Skills
We’re looking for someone who is highly skilled at the following:Performing data analysis using a range of languages, such as SQL, SAS, R, and PythonGiving meaning, insight, and purpose to information driving key business decisionsExplaining complex information to both technical and non-technical audiencesApproaching ambiguous business problems with sound business judgment and creativityEffectively managing and prioritizing projects and tasks, from multiple stakeholder groups, across project lifecycle stages (ideation, planning, execution, and go-to-market).

Additional Information

Benefits
Medical / Dental/ Vision benefits available Company paid life insurancePaid holidaysPTO / 401K / Tuition ReimbursementAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We invest in our employees, and offer extensive training, and development programs to set you up for future success. If we sound like a fit and you’re ready to start an exciting career with an organization that encourages employee growth, apply today! We look for bright, energetic, motivated individuals who are interested in learning and developing their career.
companyDescription:
For over 40 years, Momentum Financial Services Group has been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of the consumers and business owners in our communities. We rely on our large retail network and robust digital and mobile platforms to provide our customers with diverse financial products such as loans, check cashing, money transfers, and prepaid cards. 

We are a financial services company that began with the belief of putting people first. From the moment we first opened our doors to the company we are today – we have always stood by our goal to set the highest standards for customer service, convenience, and quality financial products and services.

As the word momentum implies, we want to help our customers get where they need to be. It starts with a moment – an emergency happens, an opportunity arises – and ends, not with an installment loan, but with a way to get back to work or take that next step towards the future. We believe in our customers, and we're here to provide them with a little momentum to build their positive future.  

Since we opened our doors in 1979, our goal has been to empower customers to manage their finances and reach their financial goals. We understand that a loan isn't just a loan – it's momentum to achieve a positive future. 

We believe in giving back to the communities where we live and work. We proudly contribute over $250,000 annually to charities and non-profit organizations, along with using our time and talent to serve in our local communities throughout Canada and the United States. 

Momentum Financial Services Group is a team of more than 2,000 people serving customers throughout Canada and the United States. Our employees' personal and professional goals are important to us. As a result, we offer training programs, competitive benefits packages, personal incentives, and other exciting perks. Visit our corporate website, www.mfsg.com, to learn more about our company and products.

companyDescription:
Momentum Financial Services Group, formally Money Mart Financial Services, has been providing financial solutions to underbanked consumers for over four decades. 
From the time we opened our doors until now, our main priority and primary duty has stayed the same - to empower customers to manage their finances and reach their financial goals. We have enlisted the help of smart, savvy, driven and personable people to help us achieve that goal, and we hold ourselves to the highest standards of customer service. 
For nearly 40 years, Momentum Financial Services Group, formally Money Mart Financial Services, has been committed to providing financial solutions that meet the evolving needs of consumers and business owners in our communities. Backed by a retail network and robust digital and mobile platforms, we serve 2 million people annually with diverse and innovative financial products such as loans, check cashing, money transfer and prepaid cards. Wherever customers may be on their financial journey, we have a suite of products and offerings that serve their needs. 
Today we are a team of more than 2,000 people serving customers in communities across Canada and the United States. Our employees’ personal and professional goals are important to us and we invest in learning and development to help our people thrive. We offer amazing training programs, competitive benefit packages, great personal incentives and lots of other cool perks. Visit our Money Mart USA, Money Mart Canada, InstaCheques and The Check Cashing Store pages to know more about our brands, products and other offerings.
Are you ready for a challenging and rewarding career in financial services? See current opportunities under our Jobs tab, or visit http://mfsg.com/careers to apply today!
Money Mart Canada: www.moneymart.ca

jobDescription:
Join one of Swoon's top clients in healthcare for a new contract position!
The Business Intelligence Specialist position is a 3-month hybrid (1x monthly) contract located in Toronto with high possibility of extending/converting to FTE.
The frequency of days per month in office is subject to change by the hiring manager, but is currently 1x monthly.
About the team/project:You'll be liaising with the business group to understand their problems, define requirements, and translate them into Power BI solutions and reports.You will translate business and data requirements into specifications sufficient for designing appropriate technology solutions using Power BI.You will design high quality interfaces to present information to stakeholders and convey information in a clear and concise manner.
Role Responsibilities Include:• Intake practice with report mockup and developments• Building, automating, and testing dashboards in PowerBI• Linking data within the dashboards (end-to-end process from intake to implementation)• Participate in meetings and understand what the line of business requires• Pulling from SQL databases and working with large sets of data from different platforms
What you bring:MS Power BI (Desktop, Dataflows, Report Builder, Power Automate), Tabular Editor, DAX Studio and VertiPaq AnalyzerProficiency with DAX, M, PowerQuery, SQLData modelling, designing, development and testing reportsAbility to apply application security layer model while utilizing Power BIExpertise analyzing data in source systems and conduct data cleaningExperience with Enterprise Application Processes and modeling guidelines
companyDescription:
In 2010, Swoon launched an agile, client-focused team that is not only savvy in our core industries but elbow-deep, every day, getting to know the strongest talent in the technology and professional fields. 

Today, Swoon is one of the fastest-growing talent and consulting firms in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico with an expanding client roster of Fortune 1000 companies, Best-of Awards, and legions of talent in our network. 

We are a WBENC-certified company founded by industry leaders with 100+ years of combined experience in temporary and direct-hire placements.

jobDescription:
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group
Vancouver, BC
The Data Management Team (DMT) resides within the middle office and is responsible for managing data centric processes and data quality that supports the investment management business. The team ensures that daily and historical data is accurate, data transport processes are successful, and complies with overall data governance. The DMT is a key thought-leader in driving data management maturity at Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group (CCLFG). CCLFG manages a wide range of global assets and heavily relies on the output of the DMT for a variety of functions from the front office to the back. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a dynamic strategic team whose scope and importance continues to grow.
We place a high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us have opportunities to succeed. We are a solution orientated and collaborative team seeking likeminded individuals who thrive in a challenging and dynamic environment. This is a Vancouver based role, which offers a flexibility between working from home and the office.
What You Will Be Doing
This role operates in a unique position, working closely with business operations and systems technology. Your work will consist of creating and managing investment data for a variety of global security types, ensuring high quality, and overseeing data processes. In addition to operational responsibilities, there are project and investigative aspects including continuous process improvement and ad-hoc problem solving in both an independent and collaborative setting. You are empowered to thrive as a process owner with both the creativity and responsibility that comes with delegation. You will have the opportunity to work directly with multiple partners including global investment managers, trade operations, portfolio compliance, and information technology.
As a Data Analyst, you will bring your attention-to-detail to oversee data-processes and ensure data-quality across multiple systems. You will be able to isolate and resolve data-issues proactively, or when alerted by other business partners, in a well-organized and responsive fashion. You can expect to develop into a process-owner and subject-matter-expert that provides high-value contributions to the investment process. In this capacity you will be working with a variety of stakeholders including traders, portfolio managers, developers, and numerous middle and back-office teams. You are comfortable working with databases and business applications to investigate and resolve issues as well as write business requirements and test software improvements. You will apply a continuous process improvement mindset to keep evolving systems and processes in line with growing data needs.
Key Responsibilities Include
Maintain and validate equity data across multiple systems and databases with a high level of accuracy and attention to detailPrioritize and manage scheduled processes, ad-hoc requests, and projects in collaboration with multiple business partners to support analytic, investing, and portfolio management functionsAnalyze exception reports and follow-up to ensure timely resolutionIdentify, develop and implement scalable improvements to support ever-changing requirementsProactively seek out and implement process improvements to increase efficiency, mitigate risk, and increase the level of service provided to stakeholdersDefine and implement continuous data quality improvements (policy, procedures, processes, audits)Support the Manager on a variety of ad hoc tasks and projects.
What You Bring
Education – You have a degree in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, Business Operations, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field. Completion of or enrollment in a relevant designation, such as the CFA or FRM, is an asset.Industry Knowledge – a minimum of 2-3 years of experience in the investment management industry with exposure to securities data, data process management, Bloomberg, and related tools is an asset.Problem Solver – You possess an analytical mindset and able to break down complex processes into components in order to logically deduce the root cause of issues.Collaborative – You have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively.Self-Motivated – You have a passion for advancing the quality, scale, and efficiency of data processes and are able to take ownership of multiple processes with keen attention to detail.Continuous Process Improvement Mindset – You constantly take a critical eye to processes with the goal of finding improvement opportunities and bring an ability to manage multiple projects.Database Knowledge You can understand, query, and analyze results from complex datasets.
About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group manages over $96 billion on behalf of institutional and individual clients. We believe that success in asset management is an outcome of attracting, retaining and motivating the most talented individuals in our industry. This is best achieved by the delivery of:
A High-Quality Environment – To work with people who we hold in high regard; to enjoy the time that we spend at work; to focus on productive activities without the distraction of politics and bureaucracy; to treat each other with respect.An Opportunity to Succeed – To do work that has value, and which presents the opportunity for professional growth and development.Recognition and Reward – To recognize each person's contribution and to align compensation with contribution.
Our business comprises eleven institutional investment affiliates that are responsible for investment decision making and client service, across traditional and alternative asset classes (including both public and private markets), as well as distribution affiliates that provides multi-asset class investment solutions directly to investors. CC&LFG partners with each of its affiliates by contributing world class operations, product development expertise, broad distribution, and business strategy and management. We have grown from $29 billion in assets and 200 people in 2008 to over $96 billion in assets and over 700 people today, with a continuous focus and investment in enhancing our technology platform, the types of assets managed, trading activity and geographic expansion. As we look forward, we can see both opportunities and challenges for further growth that only reinforce our commitment to attracting, retaining, and motivating the most talented people in our industry.
CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.
To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter combined as one PDF document.
Expected start date: Jan 30, 2023, or sooner.
We thank all applicants in advance, but only those candidates short-listed for interviews will be
contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.
companyDescription:
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group (CC&L Financial Group) is a multi-boutique asset management firm that provides a broad range of distinct and independently managed investment solutions such as: traditional long only equity and long-short equity hedged strategies as well as traditional, alternative and custom fixed income strategies, real estate, infrastructure, private equity and private loans. 

CC&L Financial Group provides services to institutions, individuals and financial advisors. One of the largest independently owned asset managers in Canada, CC&L Financial Group focuses on creating the conditions for success for our clients, partners and employees.

jobDescription:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English You must be living in the Canada the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in CanadaBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over. ID verification must be attached when submitting your application.
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?Earn extra incomeAccess to our community wellbeing initiativeRemote work & Location IndependenceBe your own bossFlexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyleBe a part of an online community

companyDescription: TELUS International designs, builds and delivers next-generation digital solutions to enhance the customer experience (CX) for global and disruptive brands. The company’s services support the full lifecycle of its clients’ digital transformation journeys and enable them to more quickly embrace next-generation digital technologies to deliver better business outcomes. TELUS International’s integrated solutions and capabilities span digital strategy, innovation, consulting and design, digital transformation and IT lifecycle solutions, data annotation and intelligent automation, and omnichannel CX solutions that include content moderation, trust and safety solutions, and other managed solutions. Fueling all stages of company growth, TELUS International partners with brands across high growth industry verticals, including tech and games, communications and media, eCommerce and fintech, healthcare, and travel and hospitality.

jobDescription:
Titile: Data Analyst

Location: Montreal Canada

Duration: 6 months

Minimum Pay Range: 80 CAD/hr

Responsibilities

The role will report to the and will be responsible for the implementation of the metadata management approach for the platform ensuring its execution and maintenance, as well as working in close collaboration with business partners, technology teams globally depending on the platform and others users.

This will involve participation to setup, review and quality control, governance and validation processes about data lineages, business glossaries and data dictionaries.

This is a hands-on role – and as a Collibra consultant, you will be expected to support the configuration, integration, and deployment of the Collibra suite of products, including performing tasks such as data migration, configuring workflows, defining metamodels, importing, creating and validating metadata (assets, relationships, domains and communities).

Key Responsibilities Includes But Not Limited To
 Implement best practices around governing assets in Collibra  Design integration solution between Collibra and external Application  Design/Create Lineage diagrams  Design Dashboards, Custom Domain views and Asset views  Create training plan for Users  Implement update of Collibra metadata using APIs  Document, manage and maintain data glossaries and lineage using leading industry standard tools  Champion the value of data dictionaries, data ownership and metadata management to key business stakeholders  Onboard new data domains such as finance, risk, treasury, lobs and operations  Perform quality assurance, insure the completeness and adequacy of deliverables 
Qualifications:  TRAINING AND OCCUPATIONAL EXPERIENCE 
 5 years of experience with a focus on metadata management related undertakings  3 years of financial industry experience  Knowledge of financial industry and related products focused on investment banking, corporate banking or asset management   ESSENTIAL SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS 
 Minimum of 2-5 years of professional experience supporting data projects around Collibra implementation  Functional knowledge of data analysis and data architecture  Experience using tools such as power BI, SQL, scripting language such as python etc.  Results orientation, ability and willingness to drive operations to completion in an agile environment  Advance Excel, PowerPoint, and other Microsoft Office applications   Nice to have 
 Collibra Ranger certification, or equivalent  Experience supporting the development of workflow, API, Groovy scripting, and other functional configuration within the Collabra suite  Hands-on experience with other industry leading data governance & data management tools  Experience in generating or support of regulatory reports such as BCBS 239, CCAR, etc a plus   SKILLS AND BEHAVIOURS 
 Strong strategic, analytical, problem solving, critical thinking and decision making skills  Ability to partner across functional teams and interact with all levels of the organizations  Attention to detail and the ability to complete assignment with high quality and within the timeframe  Ability to prioritize and manage a variable workload
companyDescription:
Established in 2004, SPECTRAFORCE is one of the largest and fastest-growing staffing firms in the U.S. The growth of our company is a direct result of our global client service delivery model powered by our state-of-the-art A.I. proprietary talent acquisition platform, robust ISO 9001:2015/ISO 27001 certified processes, and strong and passionate client-engaged teams. 

We have built our business by providing talent and project-based solutions, including Contingent, Permanent, and Statement of Work (SOW) services to over 130 clients in the US, Canada, Puerto Rico, Costa Rica, and India. 

Key industries that we service include Technology, Financial Services, Life Sciences, Healthcare, Telecom, Retail, Utilities, and Transportation. 

SPECTRAFORCE is built on a concept of "human connection," defined by our branding attitude of NEWJOBPHORIA™, which is the excitement of bringing joy and freedom to the work lifestyle so our people (and clients) can reach their highest potential. Our entire workflow and teams are inspired to cultivate the joy of NEWJOBPHORIA with candidates and employees throughout their engagement at SPECTRAFORCE.
