jobTitle: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
jobDescription:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.
The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformationrequirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.
The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.
The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.
Main Responsibilities
 Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30% 
Participates in data objects identification and businessrules profiling
Performs dataqualityassessment and qualitymetrics reporting
Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation
Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks
 Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40% 
Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures
Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms
Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks
Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%
Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners
Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems
Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms
Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation
Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape
 Working Conditions 
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.
Requirements
 Experience 
Managing and Handling Enterprise Data
Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data
 Education/Certification/Designation 
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science orEngineering*
Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset
Competencies
Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
Applies analytical thinking
Innovates through problem solving
Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
Demonstrates organizational abilities
Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
Works independently with little supervision
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.
Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*
Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes
Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets
Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools
Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)
Ability to present and communicate results clearly
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*
Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset
 Organizational Impact 
 Decision Making & Impacts 
The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle
 Level of Interaction/Influence 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.
 Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.
CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
 For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee's experience. 
CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.
CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

jobTitle: Analyste, conversion de données SAP et gouvernance
jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

Résumé des fonctions

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP participe à la feuille de route de l’écosystème SAP en planifiant et en exécutant des activités liées aux données et en offrant son expertise à cet effet. Cette personne joue un rôle primordial puisque le CN entreprend actuellement un vaste programme de transformation pluriannuel de ses activités, déclenché par une migration des produits SAP ECC vers SAP S/4 HANA.

La personne titulaire du poste travaille au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire et participe à une variété d’activités en lien avec les données : profilage, évaluation de la qualité et nettoyage d’objets de données de base et transactionnelles, dont l’élaboration et la mise en œuvre de stratégies de nettoyage de données; le mappage, la transformation et l’enrichissement de données de base pour prendre en compte les nouveaux modèles de données et les exigences de transformation des produits SAP; et les tâches de gouvernance et de gestion des données selon l’approbation des flux de travail, des configurations et des processus pour assurer la conformité des objets de données aux normes de qualité du CN tout au long de leur cycle de vie.

Cette personne participe aux parcours de validation des données, au dépannage, à la réconciliation des données et à la détermination de mesures correctives avant les migrations vers la version de production.

La personne en poste favorise le développement des compétences et de l’expérience en matière d’établissement et de pratiques de gestion de données de premier ordre, qui deviennent une composante essentielle des secteurs qui adoptent des approches de transformation numérique axées sur les données.

Principales responsabilités

Profilage et nettoyage des données – Tâches liées aux données dans l’environnement actuel – 30 %

Participer à la détermination des objets de données et au profilage des règles commerciales

Évaluer la qualité des données et consigner les indicateurs de mesure de qualité

Participer à la mise en œuvre de stratégies de nettoyage manuel et automatisé des objets de données

Collaborer à la validation itérative post-nettoyage et à la mise en œuvre des mesures correctives

Tirer parti des outils spécialisés et prêts à utiliser pour effectuer des tâches

Mappage et transformation des données – Tâches liées aux données dans l’environnement souhaité – 40 %

Participer à la détermination et à la conception des activités et de la documentation liées au mappage, à la transformation et à l’enrichissement des données fonctionnelles, conformément aux efforts de réingénierie des processus d’affaires et des nouvelles structures de données S/4 HANA

Mettre en œuvre des solutions de type bac à sable pour évaluer les méthodes de transformation et de mappage des données, y compris les algorithmes

Effectuer des parcours de validation itératifs et mettre en place des mesures correctives aux conversions

Tirer parti des outils spécialisés et prêts à utiliser ainsi que des plateformes de conversion pour effectuer des tâches

Gouvernance et gestion des données – Tâches liées aux données associées aux cycles de vie et aux améliorations des données – 30 %

Déterminer, mettre en œuvre et valider les exigences des flux de travail de la gouvernance et des règles des données d’affaires pour la gestion des données de base, en collaboration avec les responsables

Participer à l’évaluation de la qualité des données des systèmes cibles

Appliquer une feuille de route et une stratégie de gouvernance des données sur des outils et des plateformes spécialisés de gestion des données

Participer aux conceptions et à la documentation fonctionnelles, à la configuration de systèmes et à la validation

Schématiser les exigences de gouvernance des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise dans l’environnement SAP

Conditions de travail

Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. En raison de la nature du poste, le ou la titulaire doit être en mesure de respecter des échéanciers serrés, de bien tolérer la pression et de gérer le stress.

Exigences

Expérience

Gestion et traitement des données d’entreprise

De 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en gestion et en traitement des données d’entreprise

Formation, certification et désignation

Baccalauréat dans un domaine technique ou commercial avec un intérêt pour la gestion des données

Baccalauréat en analyse commerciale, en mathématiques, en statistiques, en science des données ou en génie*
 Toute désignation dans l’un des domaines ci-dessus constitue un atout
Compétences

Inspirer les autres par des communications efficaces et s’adapter à l’auditoire à l’oral et à l’écrit

Utiliser le raisonnement analytique

Faire preuve d’innovation par la résolution de problèmes

Connaître l’entreprise et être à l’affût des tendances du secteur pour développer son expertise et mieux accomplir son travail

Faire preuve d’un bon sens de l’organisation

Collaborer avec les principaux intervenants internes pour fournir un meilleur rendement

Être en mesure de travailler de manière autonome sans supervision

Connaissances et compétences techniques

Vif intérêt pour la gestion et la validation des données, notamment ses attributs et caractéristiques ainsi que sa valeur pour l’entreprise

Expérience pratique en planification et en exécution générale de tâches d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement (ETL) de données*

Expérience avec des systèmes de planification des ressources d’entreprise (PRE), en particulier SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Intérêt pour les processus d’affaires et la façon dont les données sont interreliées avec ces processus

Intérêt pour l’exploration des données, la réalisation d’enquêtes et d’analyses et l’application de la résolution et de la validation dans des ensembles de données complexes

Connaissance d’Excel ou d’autres outils de productivité

Capacité et intérêt dans le développement de connaissances avancées d’utilisation de plateformes et d’outils de gestion des données spécialisés comme Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia et SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Capacité de présenter et de communiquer clairement les résultats

Connaissance du langage SQL (Structured Query Language) et des scripts, notamment SQL Server Management Studio*
 Toute connaissance dans l’un des domaines ci-dessus constitue un atout
Incidence sur l’entreprise

Prise de décisions et incidence des décisions

La personne titulaire du poste effectue des tâches axées sur les données qui sont essentielles à la feuille de route et au cycle de vie de l’écosystème SAP.

Degré d’interaction ou d’influence

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP interagit avec les experts en données des clients internes et de l’I et T, des coordonnateurs, des spécialistes de la technologie des données, des architectes de solutions et des équipes de gouvernance des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise. En outre, cette personne collabore étroitement avec leurs homologues commerciaux et fonctionnels des Finances, de l’Approvisionnement, de la Gestion de l’approvisionnement, de la Mécanique et de l’Ingénierie.

Supervision du personnel/structure organisationnelle

L’analyste Gouvernance et conversion de données SAP relève du directeur principal ou de la directrice principale Transformation SAP S/4HANA, Gouvernance et migration des données – Information et technologie. Ce poste ne comporte aucune responsabilité de supervision.

À propos du CN

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.

jobDescription:
POSTE : ANALYSTE DES DONNÉES
SERVICE : TECHNOLOGIE INFORMATIQUE (TI) 
CONCOURS N° : ANALYST-OIA2210-01
ENDROIT : MONTRÉAL
STATUT : RÉGULIER À TEMPS PLEIN
ENTRÉE EN FONCTION : NOVEMBRE 2022
Kativik Ilisarniliriniq est une commission scolaire proposant des services éducatifs dans les 14 communautés du Nunavik.
FONCTION Et TÂCHES
La connaissance et l’interprétation des données jouent un rôle essentiel dans la mission de KI qui consiste à offrir des services éducatifs de qualité aux habitants du Nunavik. Sous la supervision du coordonnateur des systèmes informatiques, l’analyste des données contribue à toutes les étapes du cycle de vie des données : collecte des données dans les systèmes opérationnels, traitement des données extraites, transformées et chargées (ETL), production de rapports, analyse et interprétation. L’analyste des données sert de personne-ressource pour les utilisateurs organisationnels en leur fournissant des connaissances sur les données. Ce poste exige des compétences de nature technique et analytique ainsi qu’en communication. Ses responsabilités comprennent, sans toutefois en exclure d’autres :
Comprendre et documenter les processus organisationnels et les structures de données qui y sont associées;Servir de référence pour les applications actuelles (p. ex., pour le système d’information sur les élèves) et proposer des améliorations à ces applications pour améliorer la collecte des données;Assurer la gestion et l’amélioration des processus ETL (dans PowerShell, Python et MS SQL Server);Collaborer avec les cadres pour élaborer des indicateurs de rendement clés (IRC) pour les activités quotidiennes et le plan stratégique de KI;Créer et gérer des rapports dans Power BI et SSRS;Publier des analyses et des tendances au moyen de documents infographiques ou visuels et de rapports statiques;Répondre aux questions des utilisateurs organisationnels à tous les échelons au moyen de requêtes et d’analyses spéciales (SQL, Python).
Qualifications
Diplôme de premier cycle dans un domaine pertinent;Un à trois ans d’expérience pertinente.
La commission scolaire peut à son gré ne pas tenir compte des qualifications précitées si elle juge adéquate la candidature d'une ou d'un bénéficiaire de la Convention de la Baie-James et du Nord québécois (CBJNQ) et que la personne accepte de suivre un programme de formation déterminé par la commission.
Exigences
Solides compétences avec SQL et Power BI, connaissance intermédiaire de Python; Connaissance de .NET (C#) ou de Salesforce, un atout;Capacité démontrée de convertir des données complexes en analyses significatives;Aptitude à collaborer et à communiquer efficacement avec divers intervenants, dont des cadres, des administrateurs d’école et des enseignants;Expérience ou connaissance du secteur de l’éducation, particulièrement du milieu éducatif autochtone, un atout;Responsable, esprit ouvert, capable de prioriser la pleine participation du personnel inuit;À l’aise à travailler dans un environnement interculturel;Maîtrise de deux (2) des trois langues utilisées à Kativik Ilisarniliriniq (inuktitut, français ou anglais);Être prêt à se déplacer au Nunavik, au besoin.Expérience nordique (au Nunavik), un atout.
Classification / Salaire / Avantages Sociaux
Conformément à la convention collective du SPPENOM pour les professionnels. Ce poste appartient au corps d’emploi 2120 : de 45 420 $ et 78 640 $ par année, selon l’expérience et les qualifications.
En plus du salaire, vous pourriez être admissible à des avantages sociaux tels que :
20 jours de vacances annuelles;Deux semaines de congé pendant la période des fêtes;
et, s’il y a lieu, à d’autres avantages sociaux tels que :
Horaire d’été;LogementAllocation nordique;Voyages sociaux;Transport de nourriture.
companyDescription:
The Kativik Ilisarniliriniq, the school board of Nunavik, was created in 1975, under the James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement (JBNQA).

Under the JBNQA, the Kativik Ilisarniliriniq is granted the power and jurisdiction to develop and deliver specific educational services and programs consistent with Inuit culture. The mission of the Kativik Ilisarniliriniq is therefore twofold. On the one hand, it acts as a regular regional school board for all Nunavik residents. On the other hand, it also acts as an exclusive Inuit institution with unique powers and jurisdictions that aim to protect, maintain, and develop the Inuit language, culture, and way of life.

Since 1978, the Kativik Ilisarniliriniq has been the exclusive provider of academic services to the population of Nunavik. The education programs developed by the school board are offered in all schools of the 14 Nunavik communities, in Inuktitut as first language and in French and English as second languages. The school board operates 17 primary and secondary schools as well as 5 adult education center.

jobTitle: Analyste de données web, finances et filiales
jobDescription:
SOMMAIRE DU MANDAT

Humania est à la recherche d’un analyste de données web, talentueux, autonome, soucieux du détail et qui sait faire preuve de créativité.

Parmi les Top 100 meilleurs employeurs PME au Canada, certifiée Entreprise en santé depuis 2017 et lauréate 2020 aux concours Les Mercuriades dans la catégorie « Employeur de l’année », Humania se distingue par son expérience-employé axé sur l’innovation participative, son approche centrée sur les personnes et le bien-être favorisant ainsi le développement et le dépassement de soi!

Le rôle principal de l’analyste sera d’utiliser les technologies disponibles afin d’aider à mettre en oeuvre des stratégies et des tactiques efficaces de marketing web et assurer la rentabilité des campagnes.

L’analyste travaillera en étroite collaboration entre autres, avec les filiales, telles que L2A, les équipes responsable des données, des finances et les agences de communications interne et externe. Il développera des indicateurs de performance et développera des tableaux de bord afin de faciliter la prise de décision.

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS
Travailler en collaboration avec les équipes de ses filiales pour établir des rapports sur les mesures clés, identifier les tendances et les occasions à travers les canaux, les campagnes et les segments des consommateurs, et proposer des solutions pour leurs demandes analytiques et indicateurs de performances.Suivre et analyser le tunnel de conversion afin de mesurer correctement les performances du Web.Fournir une analyse des données sur les perspectives et des recommandations sur la façon d’obtenir des résultats de campagne efficaces par rapport aux buts, aux objectifs et aux dépenses, et suivre le coût de revient des campagnes.Développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord basés sur les indicateurs de performance clés de l’entreprise autant pour Humania que pour les filiales du groupe.Développer des rapports ponctuels basés sur des questions d’affaires.Collaborer avec les collègues du service des Finances et la direction d’Humania afin de produire divers tableaux de bord financiers et opérationnels.Effectuer une analyse des causes profondes pour évaluer les changements dans les mesures et les causes sous-jacentes et formuler des recommandations pour l’amélioration.Évaluer les retombées de diverses initiatives et mesurer les résultats. Formuler des recommandations pour l’amélioration, au besoin.Créer, gérer et diffuser des données et des informations par l’entremise de rapports courants et ponctuels à l’aide d’outils analytiques et de plateformes de rapport et d’analyse (Power BI, Excel et autres).Documenter le processus d’établissement de rapports et l’utilisation des rapports, en offrant une formation initiale et un soutien occasionnel aux utilisateurs des rapports.Collaborer avec l’équipe des finances dans leurs différents projets.Toute autre responsabilité qui lui est confiée par son gestionnaire immédiat. 
EXIGENCES ET FORMATION REQUISES
Baccalauréat dans une discipline technique ou quantitative (mathématiques, statistiques, informatique, génie, etc.)Possède plus de 3 ans d’expérience dans un rôle équivalent, y compris une expertise pratique dans la réalisation et la livraison d’analyses quantitativesDétient plus de 3 ans d’expérience en marketing en ligneExpérience dans le développement de tableaux de bord basés sur les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI) de l’entrepriseCapacité d’obtenir des renseignements sur des données Web (Google Analytics, Facebook, etc)Réussite démontrée dans la présentation de rapports Web (tant qualitatif que quantitatif) d’une manière claire et convaincante qui suscite l’actionMotivé et curieux d’un point de vue analytiqueEsprit de synthèse, rigoureux et organiséLe bilinguisme, à l’oral et à l’écrit, est essentielConnaissance de Power BI, préférable, avec des capacités avancées en ExcelExpérience en programmation, un atoutConnaissance du domaine de l’assurance, un atout
Pour ce rôle, Humania recherche des personnes performantes, dotées d’un esprit analytique et d’un sens aigu des relations interpersonnelles et de la communication. Les candidats idéaux ou recherchés sont des autodidactes qui peuvent gérer leur temps efficacement et se former tout en contribuant à la performance des investissements marketing et améliorer la présentation d’informations financières.

Note : Le genre masculin est également utilisé pour le genre féminin.

jobTitle: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
jobDescription:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.
The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformationrequirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.
The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.
The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.
Main Responsibilities
 Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30% 
Participates in data objects identification and businessrules profiling
Performs dataqualityassessment and qualitymetrics reporting
Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation
Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks
 Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40% 
Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures
Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms
Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks
Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%
Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners
Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems
Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms
Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation
Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape
 Working Conditions 
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.
Requirements
 Experience 
Managing and Handling Enterprise Data
Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data
 Education/Certification/Designation 
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science orEngineering*
Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset
Competencies
Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
Applies analytical thinking
Innovates through problem solving
Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
Demonstrates organizational abilities
Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
Works independently with little supervision
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.
Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*
Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes
Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets
Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools
Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)
Ability to present and communicate results clearly
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*
Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset
 Organizational Impact 
 Decision Making & Impacts 
The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle
 Level of Interaction/Influence 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.
 Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

jobTitle: RQ03968 Business Intelligence Specialist PowerBI Dev
jobDescription:
This is a contract position for a Business Intelligence Specialist PowerBI Development for our client who is in the Broader Public Sector. Work location will be in Downtown Toronto.

This is a Hybrid Role with somedays in the office a week. This is a requirement of the role and is non negotiable outside of exceptional circumstances.

The Contract runs for 13 months.

Hours per day will be 7.25

Advantages

Good Compensation working on projects that will make a difference to the people of Ontario.

Responsibilities
To integrate, translate and oversee design of business-driven issues and priorities into enterprise-level business

intelligence and data analytics solutions, using leading-edge data development approaches, with expertise/knowledge

in data modelling, data architecture and infrastructure, data development (including dimensional modelling) as well as

reporting (e.g. dashboard) development.
To project-manage (e.g. design, deliver and implement) complex I&IT projects and various agile, business solutions

required to meet cross-ministry business intelligence and data analytics activities and priority projects, including leading

and supporting enterprise-wide projects that may involve work with other ministries, jurisdictions and the broader public

sector.
To work within the ministry's business analytics data warehouse environment, and support efforts to enhance and

maintain infrastructure and applications, and providing technical expertise to the development and implementation of

various I&IT solutions, while working with CYSSC, ITS and enterprise partners.
To lead data development and maintenance activities that support strategic initiatives and priority projects across the

ministry, including the preparation of ad-hoc statistical information and developing research/analytical data for reporting

and analytics, while ensuring appropriate data quality, integrity, privacy and security.

Qualifications
3+ years using Power BI software development, including using DAX queries and functions

Microsoft Azure services such as Power Apps, Power Automate, Azure Database, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Synapse,

etc.
SQL Server 2017~2019Working knowledge of DataBricksAbility to translate wireframes, low-fidelity and high-fidelity prototypes and business requirements into technical tasks

towards functional reporting products or dashboards
Ability to present technical requirements to the businessFamiliarity with accessibility compliance, usability testing e.g. AODA, WCAG 2.0

Summary

If interested and qualified for this role, please apply today for immediate consideration!!!

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation
Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks
 Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40% 
Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures
Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms
Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions
Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks
Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%
Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners
Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems
Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms
Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation
Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape
 Working Conditions 
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.
Requirements
 Experience 
Managing and Handling Enterprise Data
Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data
 Education/Certification/Designation 
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science orEngineering*
Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset
Competencies
Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing
Applies analytical thinking
Innovates through problem solving
Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work
Demonstrates organizational abilities
Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity
Works independently with little supervision
Technical Skills/Knowledge
Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.
Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*
Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes
Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets
Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools
Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)
Ability to present and communicate results clearly
Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*
Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset
 Organizational Impact 
 Decision Making & Impacts 
The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle
 Level of Interaction/Influence 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.
 Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure 
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution.

jobTitle: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
jobDescription:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.
The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformationrequirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.
The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.
The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

jobDescription:

You'll get the opportunity to use Business Intelligence and Machine Learning tools to support, disprove, and interpret results to actionable insights, while contributing to define the Business Intelligence group within KUBRA.
Establish guidelines for data collectionIdentify valuable sources of data and automate collection processesPreprocessing of structured and unstructured data to align with data quality standardsAnalyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patternsBuild predictive models and machine-learning algorithmsCombine models through ensemble modelingPresent information using data visualization techniquesPropose solutions and strategies to business challengesYou will collaborate with implementations, engineering, and product development teams (e.g., Project Managers, Software Engineers, Designers)Have an analytical mind and a good business acumenYou have superior math skills! jobDescription:
This is a contract position for a Business Intelligence Specialist for our client who is in the Broader Public Sector. Work location will be in the Downtown Toronto or North Bay.

This is remote with some chance that the consultant will occasionally need to visit the office.

The Contract runs for one year.

Hours per day will be 7.25

Advantages

Good Compensation working on projects that will make a difference to the people of Ontario.

Responsibilities

DELIVERABLES:

Review IBM Cognos reports within scope of project to understand functionality, logic and design

Perform assessment, and define approach in collaboration with project team and stakeholder to migrate IBM Cognos reports to appropriate Power BI tool (i.e., Desktop or Report Builder)

Perform design and development activities to migrate IBM Cognos reports to Power BI in alignment with OPS Standards and Guidelines (i.e., AODA, WCAG 2.0 Level AA)

Perform troubleshooting and apply corrective actions to resolve issues with migrated reports and dashboards discovered during pre-release testing

Work with project team to provide relevant and required documentation to support migration activities and knowledge transfer

Participate in knowledge transfer activities

Looking for someone who can take old reports from Cognos and make new reports in Power BI

Experience/ demonstrated ability working with IBM Cognos Report Studio (version 11 or earlier) to design and develop reports and dashboards (at least 5 years of experience)

Knowledge of ETL tools, such as Azure Data Factory, Microsoft SSDT, IBM DataStage

Ability to work with large datasets e.g., 100 million records plus and ability to create Power BI datasets

Summary

If interested and qualified for this role, please apply today for immediate consideration!!!

companyDescription:
Welcome to the Michael Page global company profile.

Michael Page has five decades of expertise in professional services recruitment. We were established in London in 1976, and over this period we've grown organically to become one of the best-known and most respected consultancies, with an office network spanning six continents. 

While size has its advantages, it doesn't define us - the nature of our organic growth means that each new office is integrated into the region that it serves. It also means that as an employer looking to hire, or as a candidate aiming to grow your career you have the best of both worlds; a team that understands the market and geography you operate in, plus the resources and expertise of an international network at your disposal.

Our teams are broken down to focus on industry, assignment type, salary level and location, so your hiring requirements or job search will all be handled by a specialist who knows your sector inside-out. We are confident that our expertise can add value to your recruitment or job search process – get in touch to find out more.

jobDescription:
For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.

IMPORTANT:  In order to be considered for this position, a resume/CV must be uploaded and submitted during the application process. Please make sure work history and education are added correctly.

We are currently seeking to hire an Analyst for our Biomarkers team located in Senneville (West of Montreal).

How will you create an impact?

The Biomarkers department analyzes biological characteristics used for evaluating the progression of a disease, normal biological processes, and pharmacological reactions to the drug or a mechanism of action. Our scientific expertise is varied and covers key toxicological indications and a range of therapeutic areas, including oncology, inflammation, immunology, infectious disease, and disease of the cardiovascular, renal, respiratory, and central nervous systems.

Why Charles River? 

We offer an excellent integration program for our new employees as well as opportunities for internal growth and career development. Our other perks include:

As of Day 1:
Competitive benefits & we pay 90% of premiums (health and dental coverage). Access to a savings and retirement program with employer contribution. Vacation and Personal Day Policy. Free telemedicine app for you and your family. 

Transportation:
Shuttle service from the Sainte-Anne-de Bellevue train station and from John Abbott College to the Senneville location. Free parking. 

Work Schedule & Salary:
Starting salary rate of $19.50/HR. Permanent, full-time position from Monday to Friday. 

What will you work on?

Working in our newly renovated laboratories, you will perform sample analysis work using various immunoassays and enzymatic assays, such as ELISA, Luminex, Radioimmunoassay (RIA), ECL, SMC Technology, Simoa Technology, and Simple Protein ELLA. You will also perform method development, validation, and conduct data analysis to determine if results are within expectations; all in accordance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).

Who are we looking for?

We are seeking a motivated individual with either a DEC in Science (Biotechnology, Medical Laboratory, or equivalent) or a BAC in Science (Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry) who works with precision and strives for quality work. A self-starter with a collaborative and positive attitude who can work under time constraints and adapt to changes. Must be comfortable working under English conditions, bilingualism is an asset.

If you are interested in contributing to the well-being of our communities, not only across the country but around the world, please join us and BE THE DIFFERENCE! 

IMPORTANT: A resume is required to be considered for this position. If you have not uploaded your resume in your candidate profile, please return to upload field and attach your resume/CV.

About Safety Assessment

Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

About Charles River

Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.

With over 17,000 employees within 90 facilities in 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world. And in 2019, revenue increased to $2.62 billion.

At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of ~85% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2019.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Charles River Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer - all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

If you are interested in applying to Charles River Laboratories and need special assistance or an accommodation due to a disability to complete any forms or to otherwise participate in the resume submission process, please contact a member of our Human Resources team by sending an e-mail message to crrecruitment_US@crl.com. This contact is for accommodation requests for individuals with disabilities only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For more information, please visit www.criver.com.

jobDescription:
Overview
We're looking for an Analytics Solutions Engineer (Business Intelligence Analyst) for our Analytics and Data Lifecycle Services (ADLS) department.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing analytics solutions (e.g. dashboards, reports, conditional emails) and conducting analyses on a wide variety of issues (e.g., occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, and disability management) using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience.
Join our analytics delivery team that has been quoted by a senior Microsoft analytics consultant as "leading the Canadian public sector in our maturity of analytics".
At this time, this is a hybrid position where you will work primarily at home and be on-site at our Richmond office occasionally.
What You'll Do
As an analytics solutions engineer, you will:
 Develop analytics solutions such as reports, dashboards, analytics apps and conduct analyses on a wide variety of issues (e.g. occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, disability management)  Capture, analyze, and document detailed requirements from our internal customers in order to design, develop, and support new and currently offered high quality business intelligence reporting solutions, both from strategic and operational perspectives  Collaborate with Data Engineers, Sr Analytics Solutions Engineers, Sr Analytics Specialists, Data Scientists, and Analytics Delivery Managers to collectively deliver the best value for the opportunity  Work in a fast-paced Agile-style delivery environment 
Is this a good fit for you?
We're Looking For Someone Who Can
 Design and develop solutions that will promote usability, standardization, and self-serve opportunities  Ensure that the client's changing solution requirements are fulfilled in a timely manner and translated into workable solutions  Turn data into information and information into actionable intelligence that drives an improved decision  Stay abreast of emerging technologies that utilize analytics principles  Conduct data discovery, with minimal documentation, and navigate large complex data models to find what the customer is looking for  Write SQL as second nature and have used BI/analytics solution software (e.g. Power BI) 
Your Experience And Educational Background
 A Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or Business  A minimum of 18 months of directly related experience working in an analytics delivery capacity.  Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal  Other combinations of education and experience may be considered 
Application Requirements
You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC's requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.
If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) at the time you submit your application.
Who are we?
At WorkSafeBC, we're dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We're honoured to serve the 2.4 million workers and 245,000 registered employers in our province.
WorkSafeBC requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In implementing the policy, WorkSafeBC will consider its obligations to accommodate those staff who are unable to be vaccinated.
We recognize that our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences, and which reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply.
What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?
It's challenging, stimulating and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.
Our Benefits
Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes vacation, optional leave arrangements, health care and dental benefits, and contributions toward your retirement pension. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work - and life.
WorkSafeBC has adopted a hybrid model offering opportunities to work remotely and onsite based on the operational needs of the position.
Learn More About What We Offer .
This position is restricted to those legally entitled to work in Canada.
Thank you, in advance, for applying.
Value

jobDescription:
Let’s make Power Plants Obsolete 
The current, centralized electricity system is not sustainable. Between the climate crisis, state-wide blackouts, aging infrastructure, and rising costs, the system needs a huge overhaul. The demand for electricity is high – and getting higher – and big power plants aren't meeting our needs. We say it's time to disrupt and decentralize.
At Peak Power, we're energy nerds that develop software for the real estate sector. Our tech turns commercial buildings and industrial facilities into hubs in a new, decentralized electricity system. This means cleaner, more reliable, and more affordable electricity. We’re powering the clean energy revolution.
The Opportunity: 
Sitting within the Corporate Development team, the Competitor Intelligence Analyst Intern will play a key role in contributing to a growing organization within the climatetech space. In this role you will be responsible for conducting competitor and market intelligence, contributing to a culture of continuous innovation, keeping our investors connected and informed, and staying up to date with changing regulations.
This work matters. Even a small change to optimize power utilization can significantly impact our customers, electrical grid, and environment. We're building something that will have a lasting, positive impact.
Our new Competitor Intelligence Analyst Intern will: 
Research:
Compile competitor, energy & Cleantech market news, M&A deals, and fundraising rounds to contribute and add value to our Quarterly Report Obtain fundraising round details through Crunchbase Update our Partner List and key internal documents 
Innovate:
Create documentation around key findings derived from market research Contribute to the grant application process Collaborate on our Innovation Newsletter 
Report:
Craft Investor Updates on a monthly and quarterly basis Communicate to investors to illustrate product & funding updates, in order to keep them up-to-date, and engaged with our progress Contribute in updating our Regulatory Tracker 
What you bring to Peak Power: 
The experience and education. You are working towards a Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a related discipline such as Commerce or Environmental Studies. The drive and curiosity. You have a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude and are motivated to solve problems and support the organization’s success. You are passionate about contributing to innovative solutions to climate change. 
How we invest in our team: 
Peak Power is composed of passionate, collaborative, and innovative individuals
Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI). We believe in driving a better energy future through focused efforts towards understanding and improving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We’re Listening. We take internal engagement surveys seriously and make actionable changes based on feedback. Get Social. Fun activities including team events and game nights to stay connected both virtually and in person including fun Slack channels that celebrate our love of food, fitness, fashion, furry friends, and everything in between! 
Join us! 
Apply here or learn more about our company from our website or LinkedIn.
At Peak Power we value the unique experiences and perspectives that folx bring. This is how we build a collaborative and innovative environment. As such, we welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.
Should you feel that you don’t meet 100% of the areas of this posting we encourage you to apply and tell us more about what values you feel you could add to the team. Accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

companyDescription: Peak Power is a Canadian climate tech company at the forefront of the energy transition. We’re pushing the envelope of what distributed energy resources can do in the built environment. We’re aggregating battery storage, grid-interactive buildings, and electric vehicle assets with a single software platform, Peak Synergy, for partners to pursue net zero goals, cut operating expenses, and unlock new revenue opportunities.

jobDescription:
Eastlink is a family owned, entrepreneurial and innovative company headquartered in Halifax, Nova Scotia. We take great pride in being a leader in delivering creative competitive, customer focused telecommunications solutions, and connecting our customers to the things and people that matter most. Serving a customer base across seven provinces, our advanced solutions include Internet, Mobile, TV, Telephone, Security and Automation, Data Communications and exclusive locally produced programming on Eastlink Community TV.
We embrace diversity, inclusion, equity and accessibility throughout all levels of the organization and encourage members of equity groups to self-identify during the application process.
Eastlink is currently seeking for a Business Support Systems (BSS) Analyst in Halifax Nova Scotia . The BSS Analyst is a key member of the IT Business Support Systems team and will be responsible for performing operational tasks, configuration and project related functions. The BSS Analyst will work closely with various Eastlink business units in a collaborative manner to ensure that business applications are maintained and supported in a manner that ensures efficient and effective service delivery to the business.
The BSS Analyst must be knowledgeable about the Eastlink products and services, will work closely with the application vendors and other stakeholders to ensure performance and availability of the systems. The BSS Analyst will work within a very dynamic and fast paced environment and should possess the ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously, deal with tight deadlines, and manage within an ever-changing environment.
Responsibilities
 Perform problem analysis and resolution for application issues  Develop new process document and update existing ones  Perform configuration, operations and other related tasks on the Billing system  Manage incidents and requests in the team and ensure resolution within the service level agreement  Support the delivery of key technology projects and other business initiatives  Ensure application proactive monitoring and overall process improvement  Engage the vendors on issues relating to the Billing system and other applications 
Requirements
 University degree or equivalent experience  Application support experience  Previous telecommunication working experience is considered an asset  Configurations Management and Process Flow experience is preferred  Must have Strong analytic and deductive reasoning skills  Must be self-motivated and work with minimal supervision  Effective in identifying, preventing and solving problems as necessary in an ever-changing environment  Creative in developing solutions to business problems, and willing to consider non-traditional lines of thinking  Strong commitment to superior customer service  Demonstrate solid judgement  Leadership and decision making skills  Promote a positive work environment and understand the value of teamwork  Flexible, adaptable and willingness to change 
Eastlink is focused on creating an environment which promotes individual growth and career satisfaction. Creativity, entrepreneurial spirit and innovation drive us. We’re looking for people who have the passion for our business, our values and want to go above and beyond for our customers every day.
Why Choose Eastlink?
Eastlink operates in a culture of continuous improvement through listening, learning and adapting, which enables us to respond quickly to the evolving needs of both employees and customers. We recognize that our truly greatest competitive edge is our people and that delivering a great customer experience begins with a great employee experience. Our philosophy of developing and training our team “on the ground” not only helps to create a strong onboarding experience but also readies employees for future growth opportunities within the organization.
Get your career started with us and stay with us, your journey begins here!
Apply Now
companyDescription:
As Canada’s largest family owned and operated telecommunications company, Eastlink provides world-class television, video entertainment and communications services to residential, business and public sector customers across Canada. Powered by state-of-the-art fibre optic and wireless networks, Eastlink’s advanced services include High Speed Internet, Wireless, Data, Winston Security and Automation, local and long distance Telephone and exclusive, locally-produced programming on Eastlink TV.

Eastlink is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. That company has operations across Canada, and helps raise over $3.5M annually for charitable and community organizations across the country.

jobDescription:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

 Résumé des fonctions 

L’analyste Exploitation des données doit analyser et gérer avec succès les données générées par les technologies, les services et les systèmes du CN ou de l’extérieur.

En plus de contribuer à l’évolution globale de l’I et T du CN, cette personne veille à ce que les membres de l’équipe et les projets respectent toutes les exigences opérationnelles.

Les clients peuvent provenir de l’équipe I et T du CN ou des divers secteurs d’activité.

L’analyste Exploitation des données travaille en collaboration avec les équipes de scientifique des données, d’opérations d’apprentissage automatique et de processus de développement et d’exploitation (DevOps) pour concevoir et améliorer des solutions de données automatisées à temps plein entre les systèmes dans le nuage.

Cette personne élabore également des codes de vérification, et conçoit et optimise les outils de surveillance. Cette personne fait partie de l’équipe Exploitation des données et dirige des analyses après action pour le soutien à l’exploitation.

 Principales responsabilités 
 Concevoir et optimiser les pipelines de données pour faciliter l’extraction de données de sources multiples et les charger dans des entrepôts de données Utiliser l’automatisation pour simplifier le traitement des données Concevoir, mettre en place et maintenir des bases de données, des systèmes de collecte de données, des analyses de données et d’autres stratégies afin d’optimiser l’efficacité et la qualité statistiques Savoir repérer, analyser et interpréter des schémas, des tendances ou des modèles dans des données complexes Tester et adopter des solutions et des outils qui respectent les pratiques exemplaires d’Exploitation des données Améliorer les processus de développement et de déploiement des données Mettre en œuvre des normes de sécurité des données qui doivent être appliquées à l’ensemble des pipelines de données
Conditions de travail

 Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. 

 Exigences minimales 
 Au moins 3 ans d’expérience de travail pertinente (avec une attention particulière en exploitation des données et en analyse des données)  Maîtrise ou baccalauréat en informatique, en génie informatique ou l’équivalent  Excellente connaissance de l’informatique infonuagique (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)  Excellente connaissance des bases de données (MySQL, NoSQL, etc.)  Excellente connaissance du codage dans Python, Java  Expérience de travail avec des données structurées et non structurées  Connaissance de l’assurance de la qualité  Connaissance de REST API et de Node API  Connaissance des outils d’intégration continue et de livraison continue (Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Github, etc.)  Connaissance en gestion des registres, en surveillance d’applications et en surveillance d’infrastructures  Expérience de Kubernetes, Kafka et MQ  Expérience d’un outil d’orchestration des données (ADF, Databricks Workflows, etc.) 
 ATOUTS 
 Expérience d’Azure Data Explorer (ADX)  Solides compétences en communication  Capacité à sortir des sentiers battus  Certification DevOps  Expérience du secteur ferroviaire et de la commande intégrale des trains (CIT)  Expérience de l’Internet des objets  Expérience des projets d’apprentissage machine (MLOps)  Connaissance des réseaux, de la sécurité et des protocoles  Certification d’analyse des données (Azure, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme)  Certification d’expert en ingénierie des données (Azure DP-203, Databricks, GCP ou autre plateforme) 
 À propos du CN 

Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
companyDescription:
CN is a North American transportation and logistics leader focused on supply chain innovation and collaboration. We offer integrated shipping solutions, including rail, intermodal, trucking, freight forwarding, warehousing and distribution. 

We are an engaged corporate citizen, committed to the safety of our employees, customers and the public. CN is invested in building shareholder value and stronger communities, focused on environmental stewardship and developing an exceptional environment in the workplace.
 
CN has the expertise, the network reach and the capacity to move your goods to a global marketplace in a safe, timely and cost effective manner. 

Welcome to CN, North America's Railroad.
